title: Cloud Architect
description:
Solteq is a Nordic provider of IT services and software solutions specializing in the digitalization of business and industry-specific software. The key sectors in which we have long term experience include retail, industry, energy and services.
   

  

 Our mission is to simplify the digital world to make a better tomorrow.
   

  

 We are an insightful and dedicated team of experts. We are passionate and humble listeners, driven by the desire for the best customer understanding. We make customer success stories with remarkable experiences and solutions that deliver lasting value.
   

  

 Our over 400 experts, who work in six countries, develop and implement solutions for clients mainly in the Nordic countries.
   

  

 We are constantly looking for new people to join our growing team. Take a look at our open positions and join us in developing remarkable experiences and solutions that deliver lasting value.
   

  

**Discover More About Who We Are!**
 Are you passionate about designing cutting-edge cloud solutions and ensuring seamless integration between systems? Do you thrive in an environment where you can take ownership of projects, make architectural decisions, and work with the latest cloud technologies?
   

  

 We invite you to join our
 **Cloud and Connectivity team** 
 , where you will collaborate with skilled professionals to create
 **highly available, secure, and scalable cloud architectures** 
 . Here, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the direction of integration projects and work in an environment that fosters continuous learning and career growth.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and implement secure, high-availability cloud architectures using Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud
* Define cloud environments with Infrastructure-as-Code tools such as Bicep, ARM, Terraform, or AWS CDK
* Work with container technologies and orchestration tools like Kubernetes (AKS, EKS)
* Collaborate with development and DevOps teams to enhance CI/CD pipelines and operational models
* Take a leadership role within project teams to guide cloud strategies and best practices
* Work in either Finnish or English, both spoken and written


**What We’re Looking For**
* Proven experience in cloud solution design and architecture.
* Strong expertise in public cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP).
* Hands-on experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Deep understanding of DevOps models and CI/CD technologies.
* Strong leadership and communication skills to drive projects successfully.


**Why Join Us?**
* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Flexible working environment (remote/hybrid options).
* Exciting projects with cutting-edge cloud technologies.
* Opportunities for career growth and leadership.


**Want to be part of our team? Click Apply we'll be in contact!**
 By clicking apply you can choose to attach your LinkedIn profile or CV and application. The choice is yours! Whatever you choose to do please don't hesitate, we will start the recruitment process and interviews immediately.
   

  

 Questions? Please contact Markus Forss for more information by email markus.forss@solteq.com.

title: Senior SAP (SD) Application Expert
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a
 **Senior SAP (SD) Application Expert** 
 at H&M Group, you'll lead the maintenance and development of SAP applications end-to-end, from design to testing and configuration. You'll identify gaps, provide solutions, and act as a liaison between business and technical teams. You'll work with a global SAP platform, participating in both global rollouts and strategic maintenance, with opportunities for learning and development. We prioritize compliance, quality, and efficiency in our financial and supply chain solutions.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 

 You will leverage your system and business knowledge to propose and design high-level changes for future solutions, guide roll-out designs, and secure the global template.
   

  

* Analyze business requirements and come up with solutions.
* Configure and/or write functional specifications to develop new functionality.
* Test, support and maintain your product within SAP Customer OTC.
* Manage the full software implementation life cycle, including configuration in SAP, test planning and execution, deployment to test and production systems, and support during and after go-live.
* Coordinate and collaborate with multiple stakeholders including Business Analysts, Architects and Product managers.
* Take ownership of resolving complex issues related to SAP OTC collaborating with AM teams when necessary.
* Optimize existing SAP OTC solutions for performance and efficiency.
* Contribute to business process optimization and automation initiatives, identifying opportunities for efficiency gains.
* Perform impact analysis.
* Mentor and train junior members in the team.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 SAP Customer Order to Cash is an enabling team and an important stakeholder within the E-commerce IT landscape for H&M group. The mission is to seamlessly integrate legally compliant sales data into SAP ECC, ensuring efficient payment processes, and delivering end-to-end accounting and controlling solutions. Operating with high volume, speed, and quality, we take responsibility from available stock to customer, supporting Omni capabilities across store and online channels. Whether through our own channels or external partners, we specialize in Business to Consumer, managing online invoices and serving as a reliable source of sales data for stakeholders.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We believe you have solid experience in SAP Sales & Distribution, including design, concepts, principles, and configurations. You can work independently and, in a team, value knowledge sharing, and are communicative. Additionally, you have:
   

  

* 10+ years of experience within SAP SD.
* Should have been part of implementations and support project.
* Proficiency in SAP SD configuration, requirement / gap analysis, creation of functional specification, user training & documentation and support.
* Strong understanding of SAP SD-MM and SD-FI integration.
* Ability to explore alternatives to recommended solution and identify and shortlist the best solution approach.
* Proficiency in configuring and managing pricing procedures.
* Strong understanding of Logistics process.
* Strong understanding on order processing, order fulfillment, returns process, billing, consignment process, intercompany, revenue recognition, outputs, copy controls, routines ATP, IDocs and master data.
* Strong experience in major enhancements involving RICEFW objects using APIs, BAPIs/BADIs.
* Ability to design custom solutions.
* Experience in e-invoicing solutions.


**Additional beneficial competences:**
* ABAP debugging skills.
* Hands-on experience in integration with external systems.
* Experience within Agile ways of working is of great use.
* Good MS office skills, as design improvements need to be documented and presented.
* Experience working with S4.
* Experience in SAP Retail is an added advantage.


*And people who are.*
* You are strategic, analytical and fast in understanding and execution.
* Ability to understand and analyze complex information and share it in effective and powerful communications.
* Ability to take responsibility, work proactively and continuously improve activities in complex, quickly transforming environments.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* Staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* Included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to Swedish market.
* 30 days vacation, health care allowance and good work-life balance.
* Additional perks and discounts from Benify.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is a hybrid position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here. We are eager to meet you!
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About The Opportunity**
 Inbound Supply, a Group Supply unit, is accountable for the Design, Management and Control of the Inbound Supply Chain to Manufacturing. The Inbound Supply chain is a strategic asset for competitiveness and includes approx. 150 suppliers and 10000 sourced products. A Supply Chain operated globally, optimizing Supply for our 16 production units around the world.
   

  

 Inbound Supply is on a journey supporting Group Supply in being a trusted partner securing 5G delivery globally and Switching to Next-Gen Supply & Services. We do this by enabling an industry-leading supply chain for our internal customers through innovative methods in a complex and disruptive business environment.
   

  

 Trends of increasing product portfolio complexity, geopolitics and changing customer requirements impact how Group Supply and Inbound Supply manage our global footprint and supplier base. At the same time, the industry is leveraging new technologies and tools to digitalize and automate - as part of Industry 4.0. Our 2022 strategy outlines the steps we will take to maximize our contribution to Group Supply and Ericsson.
   

  

 We are now recruiting a talented and structured Supply Chain & Ecosystem Analyst to improve the efficiency of supply chain operations and resilience through data collection and analysis. Map and analyze supply chain ecosystems for critical areas and suppliers, identify risks and propose mitigation actions together with category owners.
   

  

 The position requires excellent attention to detail, in-depth understanding of the supply chain process and exceptional analytics skills. Interpersonal and problem-solving skills to gather information from different stakeholders to recommend ways of improving the supply chain.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Drive Product Capability simulation for selected Product segments
* Analyze Categories & Suppliers Capability simulations and buffer fulfillment and predictive risk sensing
* Interface with Category owners and Supply Operations Managers to identify problematic areas and establish improvements plans
* Develop reporting and digital tools to enhance Supply chain analysis capabilities
* Develop digital solutions for the Inbound Supply chain, mapping and blueprinting
* Identify potential risks for disruptions in supply chain, collaborate with category owners to develop strategies to minimize risks
* Support specific Inbound & Logistics tasks
* Assess suppliers’ multilayered ecosystems constituents in critical identified areas; Develop process to capture supplier’s supply chain different tiers (manufacturing, raw material)


**The Skills You Bring**
* BSc and/or MSc degree Supply Chain Management, Mathematics or Computer Science
* Minimum 2 years of experience in data mining
* Significant and relevant experience of Power BI and AI-models
* Strong communication and analytical thinking skills
* Supply chain management knowledge
* Excellent English language skills


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 765897
   

  

 ]]>

title: Incident Manager
description:
**Incident Manager – Be The Backbone Of Our Customer Experience**
*Are you interested in enhancing customer experience by ensuring smooth and efficient incident handling? Are you motivated to work across teams to keep businesses connected?*
 At GlobalConnect, we connect people and businesses across the Nordics and Germany with reliable and secure digital infrastructure. As an
 **Incident Manager** 
 , you will be instrumental in maintaining seamless experience for our business customers during incidents, ensuring they face minimal interruptions and receive fast resolutions.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an Incident Manager in our
 **Nordic Incident Management B2B team** 
 , you will oversee incident handling from start to finish, ensuring that our customers get a timely and efficient service recovery. You will be the go-to person for coordinating across our
 **Service Desks in Denmark, Norway, and Sweden** 
 , as well as our specialized
 **SmartConnect team** 
 .
   

  

 Your focus will be on
 **customer communication** 
 ,
 **technical troubleshooting** 
 , and
 **proactive incident handling** 
 —making sure that issues are resolved efficiently and that customers receive clear and transparent updates.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Conducting daily morning meetings, planning work schedules, and distributing reported cases
* Monitoring ongoing incidents, ensuring progress and timely resolutions
* Keeping customers and internal stakeholders informed throughout the incident process
* Managing communication and coordination during incident situations
* Participating in customer meetings to provide reports and insights on incidents
* Ensuring high-quality messaging and updates for customers regarding faults and resolutions
* Contributing to process improvements and streamlining incident management together with our operations teams


**Why join us?**
 You’ll be part of a
 **professional, Nordic-wide team** 
 that takes pride in delivering high-quality customer support and incident handling. With offices in
 **Stockholm, Copenhagen, Kristiansand, and Fornebu** 
 , we offer an international and collaborative environment where your work contributes to
 **business continuity for our customers** 
 .
   

  

**To perform well in this position, you’ll need:**
* Experience in telecommunications or IT, with knowledge of network structures
* Effective communication skills and the ability to handle tasks with tight deadlines
* ITIL knowledge or certification
* Experience using MS Office and ServiceNow (or similar ticketing systems)


**No need for a personal letter**
 Just send us your
 **CV or LinkedIn profile** 
 – unless there's something we should know that isn’t already there.

title: Senior CISO
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Senior kompetens inom informations- och cybersäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av regulatoriska krav inom bank och finans (t.ex. PCI DSS, GDPR, NIS2, DORA)
* Van vid att arbeta med ledning och styrelse kring säkerhetsfrågor
* Erfarenhet av riskbedömningar, incidenthantering och säkerhetsstrategier
* Meriterande om du har arbetat med ISO 27001, SOC2 eller liknande ramverk
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga, både på svenska och engelska


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 02-05-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Engineering Manager - Data & Analytics Engineering
description:
Are you ready to lead the way in data innovation at NOBA Bank Group? We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Engineering Manager to join our Data & Analytics Engineering team!
   

  

***Data & Analytics Engineering** 
 is currently defining global subgroups focused on backend, frontend, and data management. As the Engineering Manager, you will lead a cross-country team, in Norway and Stockholm, and play a crucial role in advancing our data technology and personnel. Your responsibilities include guiding data initiatives, overseeing data solution development, and collaborating across various parts of the bank. This position offers significant opportunities for professional growth, including global leadership development and engagement in exciting projects like the Common Data Platform, global data modeling, and new business reporting.*
**With us you can expect:**
 ✨ A flat organization with fast decision-making processes
   

  

 ✨ Development opportunities within your role and within the organization
   

  

 ✨ Freedom with responsibility
   

  

 ✨ Fun activities together with your team and the office
   

  

 ✨ A culture where feedback, coaching leadership and community are important
   

  

 NOBA is an inclusive workplace that strives for diversity - we welcome all applicants regardless of who you are!
   

  

**Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
* Lead one of the teams within Data & Analytics Engineering
* Oversee data-related solutions and projects within the Analytics Engineering area.
* Provide technical guidance and oversight for data solutions.
* Assume partial product ownership or technical lead responsibilities.
* Develop and maintain Power BI reports, datasets, consumer-specific models, and data marts.
* Drive the creation and maintenance of a common data platform for future global use.
* Manage stakeholder relationships and drive change within the team.
* Recruit and develop talent within the team.


**We are looking for someone who:**
* Holds a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or a related field.
* Has a minimum of 5 years of work experience in data engineering or a related field, with at least 2 years in a leadership or management role.
* Possesses strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire, mentor, and lead a team of data professionals.
* Has in-depth knowledge of data engineering and analytics principles, tools, and technologies, including data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and data visualization.
* Is proficient in Microsoft on-premise and cloud data solutions, including MS SQL, SSIS, PBI, Azure Data Bricks, DBT, and Python.


**It is advantageous if you:**
* Have project and product management skills, including experience with data-related project planning and execution.
* Is fluent in one of the Nordic languages


**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**
 To thrive in this role, you need to be a strong leader capable of driving change and managing a high-paced environment. You should excel in stakeholder management and cross-country team leadership, with a passion for innovative projects and modernization efforts. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential, as is the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You must be goal-oriented, focused on delivering high-quality data solutions within set timelines and budgets, collaborative with cross-functional teams, and possess strong problem-solving skills. A humble and team-focused approach is also important for success!
   

  

**In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.**
**Practical information:**
**Start:** 
 By agreement
   

  

**Location** 
 : Oslo or Stockholm
   

  

**Form of employment** 
 : Full-time
   

  

**Working hours:** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

 We strive for diversity of knowledge and experiences among our employees and welcome all applicants who are qualified for the position. We are committed to a recruitment process free from discrimination that provides equal opportunities for all.
   

  

**What happens when you have submitted your application?**
 The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨
   

  

*NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave. If you have protected personal information, please inform the responsible recruiter so that we can handle your personal data correctly.*

title: Systemförvaltare
description:
Vill du göra riktig skillnad varje dag? På Ragn-Sells är det exakt det vi gör, oavsett vilken position du har. Vi är ett familjeföretag i tredje generationen med erfarenheten i ryggen och blicken mot morgondagens innovationer. Hos oss får du vara med och forma en cirkulär framtid där vi minskar behovet av att bryta nya råvaror och istället använder det vi redan har – om och om igen.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Systemförvaltare till vårt team som består av 12 förvaltare. Vi hanterar förvaltningsobjekt inom hela Ragn-Sells koncernen och drivs alla av Ragn-Sells värdeord, vi tror på enkla lösningar, är ansvarstagande och har en framåtanda och helhetssyn på organisationen.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Arbete inom en av Sveriges viktigaste branscher
* En trevlig naturnära arbetsplats med bra och kompetenta kollegor
* Goda anställningsvillkor med 30 dagar semester och möjlighet till flextid samt kollektivavtal, pension och friskvårdsbidrag m.m.
* Kompetensutvecklingsmöjligheter genom vår egen akademi


**Ansvar och arbetsuppgifter**
 Som systemförvaltare hos Ragn-Sells arbetar du med att utifrån ett IT-perspektiv samordna och driva förvaltningen av ett eller flera affärsobjekt som i sin tur innehåller ett eller flera system eller moduler. I tätt samarbete med affärens motpart i förvaltningen ser vi till att säkerställa utveckling av systemstöd i enlighet med företagets affärskrav och vår IT-strategi.
   

  

 En central del av rollen är att ansvara för konfiguration, utveckling och förvaltning av vår SharePoint-miljö. Du implementerar bästa praxis för att säkerställa en effektiv och användarvänlig plattform för Ragn-Sells koncern, samarbetar nära team inom verksamheten för att säkra ett enkelt och effektivt arbetssätt i Microsoft Teams och andra Microsoft 365-tjänster. Du har också kontakt med vår support- och driftsorganisation för att säkerställa en stabil användarsupport och löpande förvaltning.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har avslutad eftergymnasial utbildning, gärna inom IT/teknik, eller motsvarande erfarenhet som vi bedömer som likvärdig. Du har erfarenhet av systemförvaltning, gärna i enlighet med PM3, och en djup förståelse för SharePoint-funktionalitet och arkitektur.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa Microsoft 365-miljöer och har god kunskap om Teams och dess integration med övriga tjänster. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av ledningssystem är det meriterande. Certifieringar såsom Microsoft Certified: SharePoint Administrator är ett plus, men inget krav.
   

  

 Eftersom arbetet är både varierande och utmanande behöver du ha en god förmåga att anpassa dig till nya uppgifter och arbetssätt. Du kommunicerar tydligt och professionellt på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Ansökan och kontakt**
 Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Personligt brev är inget krav för att söka tjänsten, besvara däremot gärna urvalsfrågorna så gott du kan. Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av Head of IT Maintenance Andreas Lundström på andreas.lundstrom@ragnsells.com,
   

  

 Ragn-Sells är ett av Sveriges främsta kompetensföretag inom återvinning och miljö. Vi samlar in, behandlar och återvinner avfall och restprodukter från näringsliv, organisationer och hushåll över hela Sverige. Våra erfarna och professionella medarbetare tror på enkla lösningar, ansvarstagande, helhetssyn och framåtanda. Vi är drygt 1600 medarbetare i Sverige. Ragn-Sells koncernen finns dessutom i Norge, Danmark och Estland.

title: Chief Product Officer
description:
Bruce Studios is on a mission to redefine how people train, recover, and feel good – every day. With thousands of members and over 1,000 partner studios across the Nordics, we offer the most flexible way to stay active and well. And we’re just getting started.
 



  





 We’re now looking for a commercially sharp, strategic and execution-driven
 **Chief Product Officer** 
 to lead our product function into its next chapter.
 



  





**Your mission** 




 As CPO, you’ll own the full product vision and roadmap for Bruce Studios – across member experiences, partner tools, pricing models and internal platforms. You’ll work closely with the leadership team and lead a tight-knit group across Product Management, Design, Insights and AI.
 



  





 From big-picture thinking to hands-on prioritization, you’ll guide what we build, why it matters, and how we deliver real value to both our members and studio partners.
 



  





**We’re looking for someone who:** 



* Thinks commercially – and sees product as a growth engine
* Leads with clarity – but isn’t afraid to dive in when needed
* Builds culture – not just features
* Thrives in high-ambition environments with strong collaboration and accountability



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Set and drive a clear product strategy aligned with our business goals and platform model
* Lead and grow a high-performing team across product, design, insights, and AI
* Define and manage the product roadmap, prioritizing based on impact, speed, and scalability
* Own both member and partner experiences – delivering measurable value to both sides of the platform
* Ensure product efforts drive key outcomes like retention, engagement, CLV and partner satisfaction
* Champion a test-and-learn culture, with insights and data at the core
* Drive the integration of AI and automation across product and operations
* Establish strong product rituals – from quarterly OKRs to weekly planning
* Represent the product function at executive level, working closely with CEO and CTO
* Stay tuned in to global trends, and blend “copy with pride” with Bruce-born innovation



  





**What we want you to bring** 



* 5+ years in senior product leadership roles (CPO, VP Product, Head of Product)
* Experience building and scaling product teams in fast-growing, member-centric businesses
* Proven ability to connect product strategy to commercial outcomes (CAC, CLV, NPS, churn etc.)
* Solid understanding of marketplaces, platforms, and subscription models
* Experience applying AI and automation in product and internal process development
* Strong product thinking across the full lifecycle – from discovery to delivery
* Confidence, humility, and clear communication – you lead with both head and heart



  





**Our values at Bruce Studios** 




 At Bruce Studios, our values guide everything we do—from how we work together to how we engage with our community.
 



  




* Own it – We take responsibility, make decisions, and follow through. We’re proactive, honest, and always learning from our mistakes.
* Be engaged – We’re all in. We respect each other’s time, stay curious, and continuously strive to improve.
* Be real – Authenticity is key. We communicate openly, support each other, and create a safe space where everyone can be themselves.
* Be adaptable – Change is constant, and we embrace it. We find solutions, stay flexible, and innovate together.
* Be bold – We challenge the status quo, take risks, and push boundaries while treating each other with kindness and respect.



  





**What we offer you** 



* A high-paced environment where you will be able to contribute and make an impact
* 30 days of vacation
* Pension benefits
* Flexible working hours and freedom to shape your way of working
* A fun, unpretentious, and relaxed team
* A Bruce Epic membership (of course)



  





**How to apply** 




 Does this sound like the perfect match for you? Apply now!
 



 Send your CV in English or Swedish and include a short personal letter in the same document, telling us why you’re excited about this role and how you’d contribute.
 



  





 As diversity is something that is important to us, we’d love to see applicants from all gender identities, ages, cultural backgrounds, and physical abilities.

title: Senior Technical Consultant – Healthcare Informatics Solutions
description:
**Job Title**
 Senior Technical Consultant – Healthcare Informatics Solutions
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **Senior Technical Consultant** 
 , you are responsible for following defined procedures and methodologies to install, configure, test, maintain, and support hardware and software solutions.
   

  

 You collaborate with a variety of customers across Europe to conceptualize, design, and optimize Philips solutions, with the goal of ensuring customer success.
   

  

**Your role:**
* Scope, design, build, deploy, and integrate ICCA solutions tailored to customer needs.
* Fulfill software implementation deliverables, including detailed design documentation, system build, configuration, and testing.
* Analyze customer requirements to provide technical recommendations, mentor and train customers, resolve technical issues, and offer proactive technical support.
* Contribute to Philips' global knowledge sharing initiatives, assess repeatable processes, practice strong configuration management and version control, and drive continuous improvements based on customer feedback.
* Be a key member of the implementation project and service team, promoting collaboration and representing Philips professionally in both customer-facing and internal situations.


**You're the ideal candidate if:**
* You hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, along with relevant certifications and licenses.
* You have over 5 years of experience in a similar role, preferably with expertise in the healthcare sector.
* You possess strong communication skills in English and Swedish - is a must have
* You are willing to work flexibly, with a combination of remote working, onsite activity within the Nordics, and occasional European travel


**This is a Field role.** 
 Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.
   

  

**About Philips**
 We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.
   

  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.


 If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

title: IT Product Owner SDAP
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About The Opportunity**
 The IT Product Owner (IPO) is E2E responsible for the strategy and delivery of the product based on the product roadmap, ensuring the Product delivers the expected business value, throughout the Product lifecycle. The IT Product Owner (IPO) manages the Product through the product lifecycle in alignment with the Product Area Strategy. You have now an opportunity to be part of setting up a new team supporting EIT infrastructure delivery to BCSS Managed Service delivery “SDAP” that is mostly based in Google cloud. The team will work with setting up connectivity for new customer sales contracts within Managed Service.
   

  

 Typical interfaces:
   

  

* Product Areas
* Business (BA/ MA)


**What You Will Do**
* Understanding customer/end-user needs and translate requirements and strategies to meaningful demands and use cases for product development.
* Define and optimize product strategy and roadmap
* Set and achieve the Product OKRs and ensure that the Product delivers the expected business value.
* Manage stakeholders and dependencies across organizations.
* Accountable for financial planning, forecasting, budget requests and actuals.
* Ensures that both a long term (strategy) and short term (backlog) perspective is included in the product development.
* Guide the product team in sprint planning, prioritization and sequencing of user stories.
* E2E-accountability for product delivery, including operational responsibility, through the product lifecycle.
* Managing interactions with service providers and ensure they deliver on agreed performance levels (contractual or non-contractual)
* Responsible for coaching the product team and to ensure that the product team(s) has the right competence mix to enable successful execution.


**The Skills You Bring**
* Minimum 5 years of experience in product/ program or project background
* Knowledge in Agile ways of working
* Finance budgeting, forecast and follow up
* Leadership, drive, encourage and inspiring teams
* Good Ericsson knowledge
* Experience in customer interaction
* Technical understanding in connectivity


 Behavioral Competences
   

  

* Working with people
* Relating and Networking
* Adapting and responding to change
* Analytical Thinking
* Creating and Innovating
* Delivers Results and Meeting Customer Expectations
* Planning and Organizing


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 765662

title: Engineering Manager - Consumers domain
description:
**We're growing fast—and so is our Consumers domain! 🌱** 
  

  

 With six teams soon in place, we’re looking for a dedicated Engineering Manager to lead, support, and inspire our talented developers. In the Consumers domain, we empower people to confidently navigate the home-buying journey and stay connected to the property market.
   

  

 As Engineering Manager, you’ll guide our teams in making strong technical decisions, align with our tech strategy, and shape the future of our products to deliver maximum value to our customers. You’ll help build autonomous, high-performing teams where collaboration, ownership, and continuous improvement are central.
   

  

 You’ll also foster a healthy team culture, drive technical excellence, and support individual and product growth. Working closely with product managers, designers, analysts, engineers, and other leaders, you’ll ensure we deliver real value to our users. You will report to the Head of Engineering and collaborate closely with other Engineering Managers.
   

  

**What you'll do:** 
  

  

* Lead and support 1–2 cross-functional teams
* Enable engineers to do their best work through coaching, mentorship, and continuous feedback
* Collaborate closely with Product and Design to drive development
* Help to drive our tech strategy and ways of working as we scale


  

  

**What we’re looking for:** 
  

  

* Proven experience as an Engineering Manager (minimum 3 years) or in a similar technical leadership role
* Passion for growing teams and individuals
* Experience working in cross-functional, agile environments
* A collaborative mindset and a strong focus on user needs
* Technical background is a valuable complement to your leadership skills.
* Experience and understanding of change management, with the ability to lead teams with stability and clarity in times of uncertainty and transition


  

  

 💚 If you’re excited about leading high-impact teams in a fast-moving environment, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.
   

  

**📆 The last day to apply is May 12. After the deadline, we will review all applications and begin scheduling interviews.**

title: CRM Specialist - Temp to Samsung
description:
**Uppdragsperiod:** 
  01-jul-2025 - 31-jul-2026
 



  





**﻿Purpose of the role:** 




 Working as a CRM Specialist at Samsung means that you will be part of securing CRM communication and campaign activities that support the acceleration of the work with successful cross-channel data driven marketing. You will play an active role in CRM project/campaigns, responsible for the campaign execution, content management, segmentation, improve way of working based on insights and data. You are comfortable working with various digital platforms.
 



  
 



**Job scope and key deliverables:** 



* Coordinate and execute CRM communication with great speed and excellence.
* Main responsibility is campaign execution with the broad variation of tasks that it involves.
* Execute go-to market plans
* Execute A/B testing.
* Successful cooperation with CRM lead in order to execute on strategic plans.
* Close collaboration with Creative team and SDS team in London as well as other internal and external stakeholders.



  
 



**Role Tasks:** 



* Hands on daily operations to coordinate and ensure the best campaign executions
* Briefing & coordination with MarCom, coordination of proofreading & QA process
* Execution of Go-to-market plans
* Execution of cross campaigns
* Execution of B2C & Marketing Automation Campaigns
* Taxi operations (sub system to our CRM system Adobe Campaign)
* Execution of A/B testing
* Working with the segmentation definition and manage requests to internal and external partners working with analytics and insights
* Working in strong collaboration with internal and external stakeholders (including e.g. agencies and contact with the Samsung European head quarter).



  
 



 CRM team plays a crucial part in the development of the D2C division. In the team you have a great opportunity be part of this journey. There is a lot of knowledge and experience within the team so there are great opportunities for development within marketing and especially.
 



  
 



**Most relevant qualifications, education and training:** 




 In order to be successful in the position, you must have experience in project management and stakeholder management, working in digital platforms in connection to marketing production and have experience of working with marketing execution plans, preferably in a global company.
 



  
 



**Most relevant previous work experience:** 



* At least 3 years of direct experience from working with CRM communication.
* Proven track record of content management and how to enhance CRM communication through data-driven refinement of messaging, subject lines, preheaders, and calls to action. Hands-on experience of A/B testing & optimization across different channels.
* Analytics & reporting skills – Comfortable working with CRM dashboards and tools to track performance, derive insights, and make data-backed decisions.
* Experience from digital platforms in connection to CRM.
* Work in a fast-paced environment, and strive for excellence in delivery and execution



  
 



**Required language skills:** 




 Fluency in English
 



 Nordic language is a plus

title: Kvalitetsansvarig till tillverkningsindustri
description:
**Om Frohe** 




 IV Frohe Sweden AB ligger i natursköna Tyresö, ca15 minuter från Stockholm. Vi är inriktade mot produktion och montering av medicintekniska produkter i korta serier med höga krav på finish och precision. I vår fabrik har vi utöver 19 formsprutor även en verktygsverkstad, projektkontor och en monteringsavdelning. Under 2024 omsatte vi 53 MSEK och vi är i dagsläget 31 anställda. Vi ingår i, och ägs av, IV Group som består av fem producerande företag i Europa och Asien.
 



  





**Om jobbet** 




 Vi söker nu dig med intresse för produktion och kvalitetssäkring. Som kvalitetsansvarig hos oss jobbar du både hands-on och strategiskt med att utveckla produktkvaliteten och se till att företagets kunder är nöjda med kvaliteten, samt att säkerställa att företaget lever upp till kraven i ISO9001, 13485 och 14001.
 



  





 I rollen ingår bland annat även:
 


* Intern och extern avvikelsehantering samt kundkommunikation kring detta
* Att utföra interna och externa revisioner
* Dispenshantering
* Valideringsarbete
* Renrumsansvarig inkl. att säkerställa att Frohes renrum uppfyller gällande krav (ISO klass 8)
* Säkerställa att produktionen uppfyller gällande kvalitetsstandarder och regelverk
* Att arbeta med ständiga förbättringar och riskanalyser (FMEA)
* Kvalitetsavtal med kunder och leverantörer
* Leverantörsbedömningar på nya leverantörer
* Ansvar för mätrutiner, mätutrustning och kopplade IT-system
* Säkerställa att ledningssystemens rutiner löpande omprövas, förbättras och dokumenteras, samt att ändringar i våra ISO-standarder implementeras i vårt FMS (Frohe management system)
* EHS och hållbarhetsfrågor



  





**Om dig** 




 För att trivas i rollen har du ett starkt eget driv, är självstartande, lösningsfokuserad samt har en god samarbetsförmåga. Du en känsla för kvalitet men även för vad som är good enough samt har en förmåga att prioritera. Som kvalitetsansvarig är du många gånger ansiktet utåt vilket ställer krav på att du är en förtroendeingivande kommunikatör.
 



  





 Erfarenhet och bakgrund:
 


* Civilingenjörsexamen eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av kvalitetsledning/kvalitetssäkring >5 år
* Tillverkningsindustri
* ISO 13485 och 9001
* Renrum/klassade miljöer



  





 Det är meriterande om du har kunskaper och/eller erfarenheter inom:
 


* Plast, formsprutning, montering
* Ritningsläsning
* Lean, Six-sigma
* Affärssystemet Jeeves eller liknande
* ISO 14001



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 




 Frohe är ett företag med högt i tak och en kamratlig atmosfär. Vi värdesätter korta beslutsvägar och tror på att ge medarbetarna stor egen frihet.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
 



 Skicka din ansökan senast 2025-05-11 till Rekrytering@frohe.se. Ange ”Kvalitetsansvarig 2025-05” i ämnesfältet när du ansöker.

title: Sales Executive - New Business - PSO
description:
**Company Description**
 Meet Unit4, a fast-paced, game-changing SaaS company revolutionizing ERP for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders. We’re not just rewriting the rules of enterprise software; we’re tearing up the old playbook. For 40 years, the ERP industry has been bogged down by clunky, legacy systems, and we’re here to shake things up.
   

  

 At Unit4, we’re all about transformation. We empower ambitious businesses with cutting-edge ERP solutions that are adaptive, intuitive, and self-driving—designed to free organizations from the mundane and help them focus on what truly matters. Our mission? To turn work into something more meaningful while helping our customers achieve their greatest potential. Want to learn more about how we’re reshaping the future? Head to our website and see how we’re helping businesses thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We’ve got an exciting opportunity, to join our high-energy, fast-growing sales team. If you’re a natural hunter, a born deal-closer, and someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, this is your chance to shine.
   

  

 As a New Business Sales Executive, you’ll play a critical role in driving digital transformation for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders in the Professional Services sector. Your mission: sell Unit4’s ERP Financial and HCM solutions, win new logos, and help our clients unlock their true potential.
   

  

*This is a hybrid role based out of our Stockholm office.*
 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Craft and execute a killer new business sales strategy to hit ambitious targets in the Professional Services vertical.
* Qualify leads like a pro and engage key decision-makers with a consultative, value-driven approach.
* Own complex sales cycles from start to finish, orchestrating cross-functional teams—pre-sales, value engineering, marketing, and more—to close big deals.
* Deliver powerful, results-oriented presentations to C-level execs, focusing on their core challenges and the Office of the CFO.
* Help prospects see the business impact of our solutions, turning skeptics into believers.
* Stay ahead of the curve by mastering our tech and keeping up with industry trends


**Qualifications**
* You’re a go-getter with at least 3-5 years of experience selling complex SaaS solutions.
* You have a proven track record in ERP or financial SaaS sales (mandatory).
* You’re a pro at navigating the Professional Services sector and understand its unique needs.
* Business processes? You know them inside and out.
* You have the charisma to inspire, the resilience to negotiate, and the vision to guide clients toward success.
* You’re a team player with a hunter’s mindset, always looking for that next big win.
* You’re comfortable engaging and influencing C-level executives, turning tough challenges into bold opportunities.
* Mentorship, leadership, and collaboration come naturally to you—you’re always ready to lift others while driving results.


 Additional Information
   

  

 Why Unit4?
   

  

 At Unit4, we believe in big ideas, bold action, and breaking barriers. Here’s what sets us apart:
   

  

* Freedom to Thrive: We trust you to own your role and drive success, offering autonomy and flexibility.
* Uncapped Time Off: Take the time you need to recharge—your well-being matters.
* Global Wellbeing Days: When we say “switch off,” we mean it. We all take time to prioritize health and balance.
* Next-Level Talent: Collaborate with some of the sharpest minds in the software industry.
* Purpose-Driven Impact: Be part of our Act4Good program, where innovation meets sustainability to make the world better.
* Inclusive Culture: We’re committed to diversity, equity, and belonging through our Employee Resource Groups like Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, and Mental Health & Access at Unit4.


 This is your chance to join a company that’s as ambitious as you are. If you’re ready to disrupt the status quo and make a real impact, let’s talk.
   

  

 Ready to take the leap? Apply now and let’s make work better, together.
   

  

 Videos To Watch

title: Salesforce Consultant
company_industry: Information Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**Senior Salesforce Technical Consultant (2–3 positions)** 




 Location: Sweden (Hybrid – Gothenburg or Stockholm)
 



 Start Date: August/September 2025
 



  





 We’re working with a dynamic IT consultancy and official Salesforce Partner, helping businesses across the Nordics deliver smarter, scalable digital solutions. As we continue to grow, they're looking for 2–3 experienced Salesforce Technical Consultants to join the team by the end of the year.
 



  





 What your day-to-day will look like:
 



 Lead end-to-end Salesforce projects from pre-sales demos and solution design to hands-on implementation and post-launch support.
 



 Work closely with clients to understand business goals and translate them into tailored Salesforce solutions.
 



 Develop high-quality technical components using Apex, LWC, and Flow; manage integrations using APIs and tools like MuleSoft.
 



 Collaborate with cross-functional teams including project managers, architects, and fellow consultants.
 



  





 Requirements:
 



 4+ years’ experience in a similar Salesforce technical consulting, admin or development role.
 



 Fluent in Swedish (spoken and written), this is essential for working with local clients.
 



 Strong technical expertise in Salesforce platform products (e.g., Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Experience Cloud).
 



 Skilled in Apex, Lightning Web Components, declarative automation, and third-party integrations.
 



 You’re comfortable running demos, contributing to pre-sales conversations, and guiding clients through implementations.
 



 Must be able to travel to Gothenburg or Stockholm office 2–3 times per week.
 



  





 Why Join Them?
 



 Join a people-focused consultancy where your voice is heard and your growth is supported.
 



 They have the happiest team in the company with exceptional quarterly NPS scores and were recently voted as one of the "best places to work".
 



 Work on exciting, high-impact projects for both local and international clients.
 



 Hybrid flexibility: blend remote work with face-to-face collaboration in Gothenburg or Stockholm.
 



 Competitive salary, tailored Swedish benefits, and ongoing training and certification support.
 



 Performance based bonus.
 



  





 Next steps:
 



 Interviews have already started on a rolling basis. Send in your application ASAP to be considered for this (and other opportunities) or connect with us on LinkedIn before May 15th.
 



  





 #salesforce #sweden #stockholm #gothenburg

title: Senior Internal Auditor
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Senior Internal Auditor** 
 to join the Internal Audit team at our head office in
 **Stockholm** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

*Please note that the majority of the steps in this recruitment process will require physical presence at our Stockholm office.*
 The role
   

  

 Internal Audit assists management and the Board of Directors of Viaplay Group by providing an independent assessment of governance, risk management, and controls processes. We report to the Audit Committee and are a team of two – this Senior Internal Auditor role and the Head of Internal Audit. We audit how risks are managed, and our scope covers Viaplay and its activities across the Group.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities will be to perform all parts of an audit:**
* Develop audit programs for audits you are assigned to conduct
* Perform fieldwork and document work performed
* Identify suitable recommendations and write audit reports, incl. reporting to auditees
* Follow up on status of agreed actions
* Support in development of yearly risk assessment and audit plan
* Establish and maintain a network of business contacts within Viaplay


 What we’re looking for
   

  

 In order to thrive in this role, we do believe you have experience in the following.
   

  

 As Viaplay’s operation is continuously evolving, the Senior Internal Auditor’s curiosity and willingness to learn and adapt are essential to succeed here as well as the ability to be flexible and proactive. As we are a small team, you will mostly be working on projects by yourself, and therefore, must be able to work independently and take ownership of assigned internal audit activities. The right candidate has a high level of integrity and trustworthiness. Strong interpersonal skills are important as well as the ability to quickly understand and build trust in different contexts across the organization.
   

  

**Successful Candidates Also Meet The Following Requirements**
* Minimum 5 years of internal audit, risk management or internal control experience
* Fluency in English
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Strong analytical skills and high attention to detail
* Well-organized with a structured way of working
* Ability to interact with multiple stakeholders across the organization


**It’s a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience from working at Big 4
* Experience from working in a larger, dynamic, preferably Nordic organization
* Fluency in Swedish


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


 Hit play today
   

  

 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Kundtjänstmedarbetare i uppdrag mot Telia
description:
Vill du bli grym på kundservice och försäljning? Skapa fantastiska kundupplevelser, jobba med senaste AI-tekniken och dessutom få chansen att utvecklas och växa i din roll? Då ska du söka till oss på Releasy!
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
**Som Kundtjänstmedarbetare På Releasy Kommer Du Att**
* Representera Releasy och vår uppdragsgivare Telia, ett av Sveriges mest framgångsrika företag inom IT- och telekombranschen.
* Vara den primära kontaktpunkten för kunder via samtal. Andra kommunikationskanaler som chatt och mail kan förekomma.
* Hantera kundförfrågningar och lösa eventuella problem med fokus på att tillgodose kundens behov.
* Arbeta aktivt med merförsäljning och leverera lösningar som gör skillnad för kunden.
* Fokusera på service och support, inklusive administrering och fakturafrågor om våra kunders tjänster och abonnemang.
* Ge korrekt information om produkter/tjänster samt vägleda kunder genom olika processer.
* Arbeta aktivt för att säkerställa hög kundnöjdhet och skapa minnesvärda upplevelser för våra kunder.


 För att du ska få en bra introduktion i arbetet börjar anställningen med 30 dagar utbildning kombinerat med praktiskt arbete. Det är en ständigt lärande och utvecklande miljö där du med tiden kommer få lära dig nya saker och utvecklas.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds 6 månaders provanställning. Det är varierande arbetstider förlagda inom uppdragets öppettider som är måndag-fredag 08:00-19:15 samt lördag 09:00-17:15. Utbildningsstart är 2025-06-09
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Kvalifikationer och färdigheter**
* Gymnasieexamen
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i engelska både muntligt och skriftligt
* God dator- och systemkompetens
* Starka kommunikationsfärdigheter
* Tidigare erfarenhet av kundbemötande service eller försäljning är meriterande


 Vi söker dig som är självgående och har en passion för att leverera förstklassig kundservice. Du drivs av att arbeta målinriktat och strävar efter att uppnå utmärkta resultat, med en stark motivation för merförsäljning. Du har en naturlig förmåga att förutse problem och hitta praktiska lösningar. Dessutom kan du hantera stress och snabbt anpassa dig till nya situationer i din dagliga arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Ansökan och process**
 Är du den vi söker efter? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Ansökningar hanteras löpande vilket innebär att rollen kan bli tillsatt innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 På Releasy är vi måna om att din ansökan behandlas rättvist. Vi använder en strukturerad rekryteringsprocess för att säkerställa att vi rekryterar rätt medarbetare. Processen börjar med att vi granskar och bedömer din ansökan genom metoder som urvalsfrågor och bakgrundskontroll. Detta gör vi för att objektivt bedöma din ansökan utifrån tjänstens krav och för att skapa en trygg och rättvis anställningsprocess. Om du går vidare, kommer du att bli inbjuden till tester och intervjuer för att bedöma din kompetens och förmåga att lyckas i rollen. Vi genomför även digital referenstagning för att verifiera tidigare erfarenheter och få en bredare bild av din potential och arbetskapacitet.
   

  

**Vi hanterar vår rekrytering internt och undanber oss vänligen kontakt från rekryteringsfirmor**

title: Manager for Industrial Maintenance & IWS Services IT
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Are you ready to lead an exceptional team and drive innovation in Industrial Maintenance IT? As a manager in this role, you will be at the forefront of leveraging IT to propel Industry 4.0, supporting our vision of becoming a world-class Industrial Maintenance organization.
   

  

 We are a dedicated team of IT professionals, which allows for a close-knit and supportive leadership environment. Our team is responsible for several applications & services used in production, primarily within the area of industrial maintenance. We manage these applications and also engage in exciting projects such as the implementations in our new hub in China and the Smart Maintenance initiative. In Smart Maintenance, we leverage production data to predict when machinery will fail and proactively prevent issues. Our team is diverse, encompassing various roles such as solution architect, project manager, service manager, and data engineer.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 You will be part of the Production IT management team where we aim to create the best prerequisites for our 85+ co-workers to succeed every day. We are in the middle of transformation towards an IT product-oriented way of delivering our solutions to Scania meaning that you should enjoy leading change. You will collaborate extensively with colleagues managing other products and business areas. You will need to be able to rise beyond the scope of your group and contribute to the development of the department as well.
   

  

 Tasks that will be part of your daily work:
   

  

  

* Be a role model to create an attractive workplace and an inclusive culture.
* Work in close cooperation with your peer managers within P&L area
* Play an active part in the Production IT management team as well as contribute to change on the department level.
* General management responsibilities such as budgeting, recruitment and people development etc.


**Who You Are**
 We think you are someone that is strong at building relationships based on trust. Trust that you get by being true to your promises but also because you are transparent, humble and open when things are not going as planned; You are good at driving change and constantly challenges the status quo, this is something that gets you up from bed every day.
   

  

 We think you resonate deeply with agile principles and love the challenge to implement and coach these principles and practices in your team and stakeholder relationships.You are constantly hungry and eager to develop even further and never stop learning. Knowledge and experience with Industrial maintenance and Industry 4.0 are advantages. You need to be proficient in written and spoken English since we have a multicultural work environment and delivery model.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Production IT is an enabler for Scania Production & Logistics by delivering IT services and at the same time developing a new IT landscape. As our current manager for this group is moving to new challenges within the company, we are looking for a new leader who can continue the journey to provide Scania with world class system to steer, optimize and digitalise manufacturing. This is part of our IT vision for 2030+ and we have a very ambitious and exciting roadmap ahead of us.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-17. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Henrik Billingfors Manager, henrik.billingfors@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Professional Services Consultant - Nordics
description:
**Connect with Quadient**
 At Quadient, we support businesses of all sizes in their digital transformation and growth journey, unlocking operational efficiency with reliable, secure, and sustainable automation processes. Our success in delivering innovation and business growth is inspired by the connections our diverse teams create every day, with our clients and each other. It’s these connections that make Quadient such an exceptional place to grow your career, develop your skills and make a real impact – help our future-focused business lead the way in powering secure and sustainable business connections through digital and physical channels.
   

  

 Are you someone who likes to use your creativity and problem-solving skills to overcome technical challenges and provide best in class solutions to clients needs?
   

  

 Do you enjoy communicating and collaborating with both internal and external teams of technical and non-technical people, designing, presenting and demonstrating the value-add your solutions can bring?
   

  

 We’re looking for a Professional Services Consultant to join our team in Sweden. Read on for more information…
   

  

**Your role in our future**
 You will be an important member of our Professional Services team, dedicated to the success of customers’ virtualization strategies and their implementations. With your colleagues you will ensure that customers successfully implement Quadient’s solutions, and as a Professional Services Consultant, you will influence the success of each implementation, forming a vital link between the customer and Quadient.
   

  

 We’ve learned that if we put our thinking and efforts together, we’ll achieve better results for decisions big and small. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute at a high level because the way we see it, your input broadens our perspective as well as yours.
   

  

 You’ll engage with sales, pre-sales and project management, defining the services portion of our solution proposal, and you’ll meet with customers to clarify system specifications, gaining an understanding of their work practices and the nature of their business, in order to develop a solution to meet their needs.
   

  

 You will develop and implement agreed custom solutions, testing and installing custom software solutions, and you’ll present solutions in written or oral form, preparing documentation and presenting progress reports to customers while also working on, and organizing the delivery of projects.
   

  

 You’ll maintain integrity and professionalism when working with sensitive customer data and information, and you will also conduct training for users and other consultants, occasionally travelling to client sites.
   

  

**Your profile**
* You have proven experience in the development of custom solutions, you’ve potentially worked in a software development environment and you’re looking for a role that puts you in front of the customer.
* You’re able to demonstrate working knowledge or recent experience with scripting languages (Java), application development, databases and analytical tools and design functional specifications.
* You can quickly explore, examine and understand complex problems and how it relates to the customer’s business, and you can collaborate and listen with technical and non-technical consumers from IT administrators to executive level stakeholders.
* You’re well organized with a healthy sense of urgency, you’re able to set; communicate; and meet challenging deadlines with competing priorities.
* You can demonstrate your understanding of common enterprise applications and experience with both Windows and Unix operating systems; you’re comfortable on the command line interface.
* You enjoy the opportunity to travel, and you’re excited at the prospect of travelling mainly within Sweden to various clients.
* You are a great communicator, fluent in both Swedish & Enlgish, and you can deliver impact through adapting your style to your audience.


**Ready to lead the way? Apply now.**
**Rewards & Benefits**
**Flexible Work** 
 : Embrace a hybrid work model blending office and remote setup for a balanced lifestyle.
   

  

**Endless Learning:** 
 Access global opportunities for growth through our 24/7 online learning platform.
   

  

**Inclusive Community:** 
 Join our Empowered Communities and engage in our Philanthropy program.
   

  

**Comprehensive Rewards:** 
 Enjoy competitive Total Rewards covering wellness, work/life balance, and more, including a generous referral scheme.
   

  

**Caring for Wellbeing** 
 : Access our complimentary employee assistance program for mental health support.
   

  

**Smart Work at Quadient**
 At Quadient, our Smart Work approach fosters connection, collaboration, and innovation while offering flexibility based on role requirements. Whether on-site, hybrid, or remote, our work environments are designed to support productivity and engagement. Hybrid employees balance remote and in-office work, on-site roles contribute daily to our vibrant workplace culture, and remote employees stay connected through virtual collaboration and in-person events. No matter where you work, you’ll be part of a dynamic, people-first community that drives success together.
   

  

**Be yourself at Quadient**
 Our values define how we work as a team: Empowerment, Passion, Inspiration and Community. They inspire us to be EPIC. Together. What makes Quadient different is how different we are. We’re a team of individuals with one goal but many perspectives. When you connect with Quadient, you become part of a community that cares - in a culture that embraces differences and values every voice.
   

  

 We will consider any reasonable modifications to the interview process. If you require any assistance with the application process, please email us at career@quadient.com
   

  

*Quadient is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. \*: We firmly believe in zero discrimination in employment on any basis, including race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, citizenship status, and any other characteristics protected by local, state, or federal law.*
**People. Connected.**
**#REMOTE**

title: Integrationsutvecklare - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Integrationsutvecklare – Forest Consulting**
 Är du en driven och engagerad integrationsutvecklare som brinner för att skapa smidiga och effektiva lösningar? Vill du vara en del av ett innovativt team på Nordens största tech-företag? Då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

 Tietoevry Forest Consulting erbjuder digitala lösningar och tjänster med fokus på integration för att stödja företag inom skogsindustrin i deras digitalisering och effektivisering av affärsprocesser. Vi erbjuder ett flexibelt och inspirerande arbetsklimat där du kan växa både professionellt och personligt. Tietoevry värdesätter öppenhet, respekt och samarbete och är stolta över att driva en inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Vi söker en integrationsutvecklare med erfarenhet inom Azure, som kommer att spela en central roll i att utveckla och implementera integrationslösningar för våra kunder, med fokus på att maximera deras affärsresultat genom effektiva och hållbara integrationsstrategier.
   

  

**När du börjar på Tietoevry Tech Services som integrationsutvecklare kommer du att:**
* Designa och utveckla integrationslösningar.
* Arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov och skapa skräddarsydda lösningar.
* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln, från kravanalys till implementation och support.
* Leda integrationsprojekt med fokus på Azure-plattformen.
* Agera som en resurs och mentor för teammedlemmar inom integrationsområdet.


**Den vi söker:**
* Har minst 2+ års erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling, med fokus på Azure.
* Har djupgående kunskaper inom Azure Integration Services (t.ex. Logic Apps, Service Bus, API Management).
* Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Biztalk eller liknande integrationsplattformar.
* Är lösningsorienterad och har en stark analytisk förmåga.
* Är en lagspelare med god kommunikationsförmåga, flytande i både svenska och engelska.


**Vi erbjuder:**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Ansökan:**
 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef Marcus Richt, marcus.richt@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
**Om Tietoevry Tech Services**
 Tietoevry Tech Services är i en påbörjad spännande resa under nytt ägandeskap. Denna förändring öppnar upp för nya möjligheter, utmaningar och tillväxtmöjligheter för vårt företag och våra anställda. Vi söker efter talangfulla personer som vill följa med oss på denna spännande resa och hjälpa till att forma den digitala landskapet i Norden.
   

  

 På Tietoevry Tech Services specialiserar vi oss på att driva digital transformation. Vår expertis ligger i att hjälpa nordiska verksamheter och bolag genom att modernisera och utveckla processer, applikationer och infrastruktur, samt tillhandahålla pålitliga, säkra och effektiva IT-tjänster. Under nytt ägandeskap kommer vi att fortsätta forma framtiden för teknologi i Norden tillsammans med våra kunder.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Sales Advisor 25h - Temporary contract
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Sales Advisor at H&M, you’ll play a key role in creating an outstanding customer experience. You’ll welcome customers, guide them through your store, and support them in finding what they need while showcasing our products. Acting in line with our values, you’ll contribute to both your own success and the success of the company.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Share your fashion and product knowledge to help customers make informed choices.
* Collaborate with your team to deliver exceptional service at every step of the customer journey.
* Ensure the sales floor and back of house are well-stocked, organized, and inviting.
* Support with opening and closing of the store.
* Represent yourself and the brand positively during all customer interactions.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Our stores are the heart of our company, where customers experience our brand firsthand. As part of the dynamic Store Team, every role—from Sales Advisors, Department Managers, Store Managers and Visual Merchandisers to Assistant Store Managers, Cash Office Responsible, and Delivery Responsible in larger stores—contributes to creating an inspiring and welcoming environment. You’ll also connect with the wider Area Team, collaborating across stores to share insights and drive success together. Alongside your team, you'll play a vital role in helping customers feel confident and express their individuality with the latest trends and timeless styles. By building meaningful connections with customers in our stores, we make fashion accessible and sustainable for all.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
