title: Konsultuppdrag | Cloud Migration Specialist (Digital...
description:
We are looking for a Cloud Migration Specialist to help our banking client with their Digital Workplace initiative.  

  

**Start:** 26-maj-2025  

**End:** 31-dec-2025  

**Location:** Stockholm (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)  

  

**About the assignment:**


As a Cloud Migration Specialist, you will be part of a prioritized cloud transformation initiative within client’s Employee Experience Domain. As a member of a Product Team, you will help deliver a set of Microsoft 365 digital collaboration tools used by over 15,000 colleagues in a global organization.


Client is currently at an early stage in its cloud journey, which makes this role both important and impactful.  

Client are looking for someone with proven experience in similar transitions – someone who can contribute hands-on while also challenging existing ways of working, asking the right questions, and guiding them based on best practices.


Your main focus will be to accelerate the migration from traditional network home directories to OneDrive for Business as the modern standard for personal storage. You will act as a key technical resource, ensuring the migration runs smoothly and remains closely aligned with project goals and timelines. Working collaboratively with other Product team engineers, you will contribute to planning, execution, and minimizing user impact throughout the transformation.


To succeed in this role, you bring a high level of technical confidence and previous experience from large-scale migrations in enterprise environments. A background in Digital Workplace – where you've worked with **endpoint management, hardware policies, and user environments** – is considered highly valuable.

**Requirements:**

* Expertise in Intune and Group Policy Objects (GPOs) for device and user management
* Strong knowledge of networking, including bandwidth and file access performance
* Deep understanding of NTFS permissions and their application in OneDrive and SharePoint Online
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Migration Manager and similar migration tools
* Proficiency in PowerShell scripting for automation and troubleshooting
  

**Meritorious qualifications:**

* Experience in Digital Workplace, with responsibility for hardware, device management, and policies. Client are looking for an individual who can challenge current plans and approaches, particularly in areas where the team lacks the necessary expertise.
  

**Preferred soft skills to be successful in the role:**


You have extensive experience with OneDrive for Business and have led large-scale migrations from on-premises network drives in global environments. You understand common migration challenges and best practices and know how to minimize downtime and user disruption.

 **Om oss**

*Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.*  

*Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.*  

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: Security Engineer
description:
**Role:**  

Driving the different NIST based security control implementations in the various digital products.

**Essential requirements:**  

* Having good understanding of NIST security framework / controls . Should be able to drive the security architecture level discussion with the product team.
* Understanding webApp and mobile app tiered architecture. (including but not limited to webApp servers, database servers, firewall, VNET (or VPC) concepts.
* Container Security.
* Industry recognized SAST /SCA tools understanding for eg. GHAS
* Microsoft Azure (from securing various managed/unamanaged services in the cloud). Any certification around Microsoft Azure cloud is preferred.
* Concept of Threat Modelling and what are various vulnerabilities around various interfaces in a typical webApp/enterprise app/cloud infrastructure and mobile app architecture.
* Very good understanding of Owasp Top 10 application security risks.
* Having a CISSP or CISM certification can bring the edge.
* Good verbal and written communication skill (person would be required to educate other functions about the values of cyber security activities).
* Having a good industry experience would be preferred.
 **Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Malmö  

**Period**: 09-05-2025-31-08-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 05-05-2025  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Information Security Manager
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*  

  

*So, i**f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn**’**t* *perfectly* *align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* *rapidly* *growing* *business**.*

**About us:**


Stegra is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.


We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.

 **Information** **Security Manager**


As the Information Security Manager you will oversee the implementation of security requirements and capabilities across Stegra’s digital and operational technology (OT) environments. This includes creating directives, performing threat modeling and risk assessments, defining architectural guidelines, and supporting mitigation efforts. You will also be responsible for building internal security competence through training and leadership, ensuring our teams have the skills needed to maintain robust security measures. In this role, you will work cross-functionally, collaborating with diverse teams across the organization.


**Responsibilities:**

**Leadership & Strategy**

* Align the organization’s information security strategy with business goals and evolving risks.
* Lead efforts to secure digital and OT environments, supporting transformation initiatives.
* Provide guidance to production and manufacturing teams on information and cyber-related matters.

**Policy Development & Compliance**

* Develop, update, and enforce security policies, directives, and requirements.
* Ensure compliance with frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIST, and GDPR.
* Conduct assessments to verify adherence to policies and regulatory requirements.
* Maintain internal control over financial processes in line with auditing standards.

**Risk Management**

* Perform regular risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and threats.
* Implement mitigation strategies to address identified risks.
* Develop and maintain risk management framework

**Team Leadership & Collaboration**

* Mentor and upskill development and operational teams to build internal security competence.
* Foster security awareness and best practices across the organization.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with finance, HR, legal, and digital teams to embed security into all operations.

**Operations & Reporting**

* Oversee security tools and systems, ensuring readiness to protect, detect and respond to threats.
* Oversee managed services, e.g. SOC operations
* Develop dashboards and reporting practices to track key metrics, incident mitigations, and security maturity levels

**Qualifications:**


We’re looking for someone with:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, cybersecurity, or a related field; a master’s degree is a plus.
* Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CEH are meritorious.
* Proficiency in security tools, technologies, and frameworks, including cloud, OT, network, and application security.
* Experience with security automation and architectural guidelines.
* Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze complex systems, identify security risks, and develop effective solutions.
* Proven leadership experience with a track record of managing teams or/and projects successfully.
* Excellent cross-functional collaboration and communication skills, ensuring alignment and integration of security measures across the organization.

**Personal qualities**


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative and drives security efforts that create real impact. A practical, solution-oriented mindset is essential, as you’ll navigate complex systems and find effective ways to secure both digital and operational environments. Curiosity and a proactive approach will help you stay ahead of emerging security challenges. With a forward-looking perspective, you’ll play a key role in driving change and strengthening the security culture across the organization.

**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden


Applications will be reviewed continuously so do not hesitate to send in your application!

title: Mekanikkonsult till Lumibird
description:
**Tog du nyligen examen inom maskinteknik och vill arbeta med mekanik och konstruktion? Lumibird söker nu en nyexaminerad mekanikkonsult med intresse för att vara med och utveckla morgondagens laserteknik.** **Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv**

 **Att jobba som Mekanikkonsult hos Lumibird**

  

Lumibird Photonics Sweden AB skapar mekanik för att konstruera lasersändare och lasrar, tillverkar laseravståndsmätare till olika militära applikationer och har en agil tillverkning med ansvar från ax till limpa. Hela produktionen hanterar både nytillverkning och reparation av både system och delsystem i samma tillverkningsflöde.


I rollen som Mekanikkonsult hos Lumibird kommer du att arbeta med produktutveckling, från koncept till färdig produkt. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat att innefatta:

* Utveckling av produkter i Creo
* Dokumentation
* Jobba med förbättringsarbete för system

  

Rollen är placerad i **Göteborg.**

**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**


Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos **Lumibird** i Göteborg med start till hösten**.** Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos **Lumibird** samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos **Lumibird**.

**Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en **universitets/civilingenjörsexamen** inom **maskinteknik eller motsvarande**
* Har ett intresse för **konstruktion, mekanik, design**
* Som person är **du driven, nyfiken och initiativtagande**
* Har goda kunskaper i **Creo eller motsvarande CAD program**


Meriterande om du:

* Har erfarenhet av fräst mekanik
* Har erfarenhet av arbete i mekanisk verkstad


För företag inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin i Sverige, kräver lagen att anställda som hanterar känslig information och teknologi ska vara svenska medborgare samt genomgå en säkerhetsprövning.

**Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Kristofer Hedlundpå **Kristofer.Hedlund@nexergroup.com**

  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

 **Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är specialiserade på att ge nyutexaminerade techtalanger en ultimat start på karriären genom våra ettåriga talangprogram. Vi matchar talangers unika kompetens, personlighet och potential med ett uppdrag hos ett av Sveriges främsta bolag. Uppdraget varvas med en gedigen utbildning, mentorskap och sociala aktiviteter. Nexer Tech Talent ger techtalanger en ultimat övergång mellan studier och arbetsliv och en brant utvecklingskurva mot en lovande framtid. Vi är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt.*

title: Business Development Manager - OT
description:
**Role: Business Development Manager - OT**

The Business Development Manager is responsible for establishing relationships with large and medium sized businesses (customers/partners) on behalf of Fortinet as well as maintaining and growing business with install base partners/customers.  



  

This role will sell the breadth of Fortinet’s capabilities, with specific focus on public cloud engagements, infrastructure and security services. The role holder will manage the engagement and development of significant deals and have an outstanding track record of selling complex solutions and services in full collaboration with the in country/territory team of Major Account Managers, Channel Managers etc.  



Over time, there will be more and more Fortinet partners/customers whom have legacy infrastructure to run their workloads, but want to transform into the new agile, digital world. To ensure there is a stronger “pull” towards new world over legacy (ensuring long term customer/journey and revenues), we would need a BDM whose primary focus is on the digital world but also has legacy world experience. From an outside perspective, this will look smooth and consistent to our partners/customers/prospects.  



**Overall sales/technical expertise**

* Has held various roles across numerous sectors and consultancy experience desirable
* Success track record in growing business in an international IT vendor
* Qualified and expertise in a public cloud such as AWS or Azure or GCP and most importantly, understand new world approach to fault tolerance, resilient architectures (high availability, fail over, DR) etc..;
* Understanding of modern methodologies and movements such as: design thinking, agile and lean business models as this is even more important to partners/customers and proposals;
* Understanding of current and in future technologies such as: AI such as machine learning, container security etc…;
* Experience in big complex digital transformations
Understand Innovation, how to enable innovation (different approach for each partner/customer) and how this leads to differentiation and market disruption  
* 

**Responsibilities/Accountabilities**

* Lead the development of an effective portfolio business plan outlining the strategy for success and maximising revenues.
* Responsible for ensuring partner/customer satisfaction is maintained at the highest levels.
* Develop account plans that focus on client relationship development and account growth/retention within install base and net new customers/partners.
* Find and develop profitable new accounts and business opportunities within a channel driven mentality.
* Manage and develop a long-term sustainable pipeline of new deals, into both install base and net new partners/customers.
* Map, build and deploy a long-term relationship with the Public Cloud Vendors (Microsoft, Google, AWS, Oracle, Alibaba…)
* Achieve the revenue targets set out, build pro-active plans generating pipeline.
* Maintain close knowledge of the client’s business and Fortinets’ service portfolio to ensure alignment of appropriate up selling and cross selling of Fortinet solutions.
* Produce workable quarterly/annual business and activity plans for the region and/or market segment and develop profit improvement plans to justify the value of our solutions/services to our partners/customers.
* Record and maintain all relevant information regarding partner/customers and contacts, prospects and suspects in Salesforce.
* Ensure full communication of Fortinets’ sales & marketing objectives to all partners/customers/accounts.
* Ensure that the public cloud sales pipeline model is kept updated by providing timely and accurate forecasting and pipeline information.
* Develop and maintain partner/customer relationships at multiple levels including problem solving and formulation of response to immediate and future partner/customer requirements.
* Works with third party advisory organisations and attends third party vendor meetings.
* Prepare and deliver sales proposals and presentations.
Prepare partner/customer/ alliance or account planning documents for specific services and solutions.  
* 

**Skills/Experience**

* Minimum 5-year demonstrable record of accomplishment in selling complex outsourcing and managed service solutions to the enterprise and mid-market within a channel driven mentality.
* Strong understanding of workspace, cloud and managed service solutions.
* Proven track record of winning, leading and implementing complex deals.
* Experience selling solutions incorporating cloud, connectivity, and technologies.
* Ability to construct innovative deals that play to Fortinets’ strengths, both meeting and exceeding client expectations.
* Understanding of organisational navigation: ability to get things done in a complex environment both externally and internally.
* Strong problem solving and negotiating skills at Director level.
* Strong planning and organisation skills, and compelling presentation skills.
* Be used to working in high pressure environments, on your own and as part of a team.
* Broad understanding of the Information Technology marketplace.
* A proven network of senior level (Director and above) contacts
* Strong interpersonal skills, able to build trust and long-term relationships within the client organisation.
Proactive change agent, able to understand both the client’s and Fortinets’ business requirements to achieve a win-win outcome.  
* 

**Qualification/Certification requirements**

* Graduate level (preferred) or through proven experience / reference
* Appropriate Sales and negotiation abilities
Project Management experience would be beneficial.  
* 

**Fortinet**  

  

From the start, the Fortinet vision has been to deliver broad, truly integrated, high-performance security across the IT infrastructure. Today, we secure the largest enterprises, service providers and government organizations around the world.
  

  

Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network – today and into the future. We have proven to be a truly innovative technology driven network security company with over 619 registered Global Patents. This is over 3 times more than our closest most innovative competitor!
  

  

**A**
company_description: Mission: Dedicated to Delivering Security Without Compromise

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
Why Join Us?
At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.  

  

To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.  

We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.  

As a Test Automation Engineer, you will play a pivotal part in defining, maintaining and executing automated test suites. You’ll join our autonomous and self-organized Cloud team and will be a key member in shaping and driving our adoption of automated testing and verification practices. Your work will help ensure the highest standards of quality, resilience, security and availability across our infrastructure and services. These support a complex, cross-platform suite of client applications used both publicly and internally.  

In this role, you’ll work with:* Taking ownership of and maintaining test suite definitions in collaboration with the team
* Designing, developing and deploying automation to new and existing test suites
* Setting the foundation and maintaining a mature, quality-first way of working, supporting the development team and other stakeholders in making choices for shared future success
* Taking a leading role in supporting & coaching team members in test practices, building a positive environment of collaboration and continuous, actionable and constructive feedback between peers
* Collecting and structuring data on test suite execution, yielding insights into quality metrics over time
  

What we’re looking for:
We’re looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys working closely with others to solve technical challenges. We also believe that you have the ability to clearly articulate ideas, visions and plans effectively. You’re proactive and continuously seek opportunities to improve ways of working, contribute to new ideas and share knowledge that elevates the team.
For this position, we’re looking for someone with solid experience in:* Modern test automation practices, including stress testing of service and UI based testing of web applications
* Testing in cloud environments (Azure)
* Collaborating and working directly in software development teams, with a strong understanding of software development challenges and common pitfalls

Our Values:
At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
What We Offer:
At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.
company_description: Tobii Dynavox’s mission is to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did, or never thought possible.

title: Security Engineer
description:
### **Requirements**


* Having good understanding of NIST security framework / controls.
* Should be able to drive the security architecture level discussion with the product team.
* Understanding webApp and mobile app tiered architecture. (including but not limited to webApp servers, database servers, firewall, VNET (or VPC) concepts.
* Container Security.
* Industry recognized SAST /SCA tools understanding for eg. GHAS.
* Microsoft Azure (from securing various managed/unmanaged services in the cloud). Any certification around Microsoft Azure cloud is preferred.
* Concept of Threat Modelling and what are various vulnerabilities around various interfaces in a typical webApp/enterprise app/cloud infrastructure and mobile app architecture.
* Very good understanding of Owasp Top 10 application security risks.
* Having a CISSP or CISM certification can bring the edge.
* Good verbal and written communication skill (person would be required to educate other functions about the values of cyber security activities).
* Having a good industry experience would be preferred.

title: Cloud Migration Specialist (Digital Workplace)
description:
**Start****25-05-2025****Duration****7-9 months**
  
emagine is looking for a Cloud Migration Specialist to help our banking client with their Digital Workplace initiative.  

  

**Start:** 26-maj-2025  

**End:** 31-dec-2025  

**Location:** Stockholm (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)  

  

**FOR THIS ROLE THERE IS A MATRIX**  

  

**About the assignment:**


As a Cloud Migration Specialist, you will be part of a prioritized cloud transformation initiative within client’s Employee Experience Domain. As a member of a Product Team, you will help deliver a set of Microsoft 365 digital collaboration tools used by over 15,000 colleagues in a global organization.


Client is currently at an early stage in its cloud journey, which makes this role both important and impactful.
  

Client are looking for someone with proven experience in similar transitions – someone who can contribute hands-on while also challenging existing ways of working, asking the right questions, and guiding them based on best practices.

  

Your main focus will be to accelerate the migration from traditional network home directories to OneDrive for Business as the modern standard for personal storage. You will act as a key technical resource, ensuring the migration runs smoothly and remains closely aligned with project goals and timelines. Working collaboratively with other Product team engineers, you will contribute to planning, execution, and minimizing user impact throughout the transformation.


To succeed in this role, you bring a high level of technical confidence and previous experience from large-scale migrations in enterprise environments. A background in Digital Workplace – where you've worked with **endpoint management, hardware policies, and user environments** – is considered highly valuable.

 **Requirements:**

* Expertise in Intune and Group Policy Objects (GPOs) for device and user management
* Strong knowledge of networking, including bandwidth and file access performance
* Deep understanding of NTFS permissions and their application in OneDrive and SharePoint Online
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Migration Manager and similar migration tools
* Proficiency in PowerShell scripting for automation and troubleshooting

 **Meritorious qualifications:**

* Experience in Digital Workplace, with responsibility for hardware, device management, and policies. Client are looking for an individual who can challenge current plans and approaches, particularly in areas where the team lacks the necessary expertise.

 **Preferred soft skills to be successful in the role:**


You have extensive experience with OneDrive for Business and have led large-scale migrations from on-premises network drives in global environments. You understand common migration challenges and best practices and know how to minimize downtime and user disruption.

title: Grafisk kommunikationsstudent til anklagemyndigheden
description:
**Kan du trylle med grafik og billeder og få en præsentation til at se godt ud? Kan du lave visuelt flotte SoMe-opslag? Kan du hjælpe med at få vores nye hjemmeside til at stå visuelt levende og skarp? Så er du måske vores nye grafiske studentermedhjælp, og kan blive en del af en professionel kommunikationsenhed, hvor du får ansvar for dine egne opgaver.**


**Stillingen er ledig til besættelse 1. juli 2025 eller snarest muligt derefter.**


Vi er syv medarbejdere i vores team, en kommunikationschef, fire presse- og kommunikationsrådgivere og to studerende, der arbejder tæt sammen med resten af anklagemyndigheden om at fortælle om anklagemyndighedens arbejde med straffesager. Vi producerer interne og eksterne nyheder til intranet, hjemmeside og LinkedIn og arbejder bl.a. med medietræning, pressehåndtering, employer branding og forskellige events.


Din opgaver bliver bl.a. at hjælpe med, at:


* Løse en række forskellige grafiske opgaver, som visuelle SoMe-opslag, publikationer, præsentationer, udvikling og, hjemmeside mv.
* Være med til at opbygge vores billedarkiv i Skyfish
* Publicere og redigere indhold på vores hjemmeside og intranetAssistere ved planlægning og afvikling af events og undervisningsforløb
* Løse diverse ad hoc kommunikationsopgaver
* Rentegning


**Den rette kandidat**


Du skal være i gang med en videregående uddannelse, men det betyder ikke så meget for os, om du er i gang med din bachelor eller din kandidat. Det vigtigste for os er, at du er velsignet med nysgerrighed og kreativitet. Vi lover dig til gengæld en hverdag fuld af store og små opgaver.


Du bliver du en del af vores team, så vi vil sørge for, at du udvikler dig, at du bliver udfordret, og at du får de bedst tænkelige rammer til at udøve din metier: skarp, visuel og levende kommunikation. Vi står klar til at hjælpe og støtte dig så meget, som du har brug for. Du vil få ansvar for dine egne opgaver, og der vil være opgave, du er lead på. Vi forestiller os, at du:


* Er i gang med en uddannelse inden for visuel kommunikation eller grafiske arbejde og gerne har minimum to år tilbage af dit studie
* Har flair for at bruge billeder og grafik til at omsætte budskaber visuelt
* Har erfaring med værktøjerne i Creative Cloud og PowerPoint
* Kan arbejde inden for rammerne af en designmanual, så vi holder en rød tråd i udtrykket på tværs af alle kanaler og produkter
* Er skarp på digital kommunikation, web og sociale medier
* Arbejder selvstændigt, struktureret og ansvarsfuldt med dine opgaver
* Er positiv, initiativrig og samarbejdsorienteret og går til dine opgaver med gåpåmod


**Ansøgning og ansættelsesvilkår**


Ansættelse sker efter gældende overenskomst, og arbejdstiden er på 15 timer ugentligt fordelt på to hele dage.


Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan blive sikkerhedsgodkendt, ligesom du skal kunne opretholde sikkerhedsgodkendelsen gennem hele din ansættelse.


Du søger stillingen via linket.


Vi glæder os til at modtage din ansøgning med CV og karakterudskrift senest den 16. maj 2025. Du er velkommen til at vedhæfte eksempler på relevante tekster eller opgaver, du har udformet.


Vi holder løbende samtaler, så send gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt.


Vi opfordrer alle kvalificerede ansøgere til at søge stillingen uanset alder, køn, race, religion eller etnisk baggrund.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte kommunikationskonsulent Christina Birgitte Andersen på tlf. 3031 2074 eller mail cbi@ankl.dk


Du kan læse mere om anklagemyndigheden på vores hjemmeside www.anklagemyndigheden.dk

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
We are seeking two highly motivated and business-driven Senior Data Analysts to join our banking data analysis team. You will bring your expertise and proactive attitude towards change and growth to our ever-evolving environment!
  

  

**Get an idea of the role**


In this role, you will play a critical part in delivering measurable business outcomes through financial and product analysis, supporting Business, Product and Operations management, and driving proactive insights that shapes strategic decision-making. The role includes broad data work within the team and some maintenance of our current analytics applications and scheduled solutions. Aligned with our operating model, we measure success by real business impact, not just effort. As a Senior Data Analyst, you are expected to take full accountability for your analysis and recommendations, lead by example through a results-driven mindset, and contribute to a high-performing, collaborative team. Furthermore, you will..


* Drive analytics delivery for your business domain area. Deliver clear, outcome-oriented analysis in areas needed supporting our transformation, business performance, and product profitability, focusing on results that drive real impact.
* Create and own a map of analytics solutions for your business domain and work on always improving and making sure that analytics solutions portfolio is aligned with business/product needs.
* Query and manage large datasets using SQL, ensuring clarity, quality, and effectiveness in data interpretation.
* Develop and maintain impactful dashboards and business intelligence reports using QlikSense and future BI platforms of our choosing.
* Actively lead and contribute to the adoption and integration of cloud-based technologies.
* Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders, setting the tone by embodying ownership, accountability, and a clear focus on aligned business direction.

**On a personal level**
  

  

We are looking for someone with strong accountability of analysis, result and recommendations. Someone who has the ability to deliver in fast-paced environments while maintaining focus on business KPIs. You have high resilience, a critical thinking and a proactive approach to navigating uncertainty and change. Effective communication and stakeholder engagement are things you value, and with a team player mentality you prioritize collective success and always have commitment to continuous growth – for self and colleagues. To thrive in this role, we believe you have..


* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
* Minimum 5–7 years in data analysis, preferably within the banking, retail finance or financial services sector
* Advanced proficiency in SQL
* Experience with QlikSense and familiarity with other BI tools
* Exposure or willingness to learn Python and adapt to cloud-based querying technologies
* Solid understanding of banking operations, financial products, and business/product profitability
* Ability to be in Helsingborg office at least one week per month

**Resurs** **in brief**


At Resurs, we make everyday finances easier through innovative and customer-focused solutions. With customers across the Nordics and a team of around 700 colleagues, we are committed to delivering long-term value for individuals, businesses, and society. Being named a career company for the past six years, we have a strong focus on emphasizing both personal and professional growth. With an inclusive and diverse culture, we create a workplace where employees are valued, supported, and encouraged to reach their full potential.

 **Apply today!**


Don’t wait to send in your application. Selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled before the last application date.


We look forward to hearing from you!

**Important information**


On final candidates, we carry out a detailed background check via an external company.

* *In this recruitment process, the supplier is solely responsible for the personal data they collect and process.* Resurs is solely responsible for the personal data processed by us in the recruitment process.

  

*#LI-LN1*

Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Lumibird i Göteborg med start till hösten. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.
  
Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Lumibird samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Lumibird.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Är i början av din karriär och har en universitets/civilingenjörsexamen inom maskinteknik eller motsvarande
  
Har ett intresse för konstruktion, mekanik, design
  
Som person är du driven, nyfiken och initiativtagande
  
Har goda kunskaper i Creo eller motsvarande CAD program
  
  

**Meriterande om du:**  

Har erfarenhet av fräst mekanik
  
Har erfarenhet av arbete i mekanisk verkstad
  
  

För företag inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin i Sverige, kräver lagen att anställda som hanterar känslig information och teknologi ska vara svenska medborgare samt genomgå en säkerhetsprövning.
  
  

Ansökan
  
Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Kristofer Hedlund på Kristofer.Hedlund@nexergroup.com
  
  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  
  

Om Nexer Tech Talent
  
Nexer Tech Talent är specialiserade på att ge nyutexaminerade techtalanger en ultimat start på karriären genom våra ettåriga talangprogram. Vi matchar talangers unika kompetens, personlighet och potential med ett uppdrag hos ett av Sveriges främsta bolag. Uppdraget varvas med en gedigen utbildning, mentorskap och sociala aktiviteter. Nexer Tech Talent ger techtalanger en ultimat övergång mellan studier och arbetsliv och en brant utvecklingskurva mot en lovande framtid. Vi är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt.

title: Information Security Manager
description:
Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel. So, if you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn’t perfectly align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our rapidly growing business.
  
  

**About us:**  

Stegra is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.
  
We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.
  
Information Security Manager
  
As the Information Security Manager you will oversee the implementation of security requirements and capabilities across Stegra’s digital and operational technology (OT) environments. This includes creating directives, performing threat modeling and risk assessments, defining architectural guidelines, and supporting mitigation efforts. You will also be responsible for building internal security competence through training and leadership, ensuring our teams have the skills needed to maintain robust security measures. In this role, you will work cross-functionally, collaborating with diverse teams across the organization.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Leadership & Strategy
  
Align the organization’s information security strategy with business goals and evolving risks.
  
Lead efforts to secure digital and OT environments, supporting transformation initiatives.
  
Provide guidance to production and manufacturing teams on information and cyber-related matters.
  
  

Policy Development & Compliance
  
Develop, update, and enforce security policies, directives, and requirements.
  
Ensure compliance with frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIST, and GDPR.
  
Conduct assessments to verify adherence to policies and regulatory requirements.
  
Maintain internal control over financial processes in line with auditing standards.
  
  

Risk Management
  
Perform regular risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and threats.
  
Implement mitigation strategies to address identified risks.
  
Develop and maintain risk management framework
  
  

Team Leadership & Collaboration
  
Mentor and upskill development and operational teams to build internal security competence.
  
Foster security awareness and best practices across the organization.
  
Collaborate cross-functionally with finance, HR, legal, and digital teams to embed security into all operations.
  
  

Operations & Reporting
  
Oversee security tools and systems, ensuring readiness to protect, detect and respond to threats.
  
Oversee managed services, e.g. SOC operations
  
Develop dashboards and reporting practices to track key metrics, incident mitigations, and security maturity levels
  
  

**Qualifications:****We’re looking for someone with:**  

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, cybersecurity, or a related field; a master’s degree is a plus.
  
Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CEH are meritorious.
  
Proficiency in security tools, technologies, and frameworks, including cloud, OT, network, and application security.
  
Experience with security automation and architectural guidelines.
  
Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze complex systems, identify security risks, and develop effective solutions.
  
Proven leadership experience with a track record of managing teams or/and projects successfully.
  
Excellent cross-functional collaboration and communication skills, ensuring alignment and integration of security measures across the organization.
  
  

Personal qualities
  
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative and drives security efforts that create real impact. A practical, solution-oriented mindset is essential, as you’ll navigate complex systems and find effective ways to secure both digital and operational environments. Curiosity and a proactive approach will help you stay ahead of emerging security challenges. With a forward-looking perspective, you’ll play a key role in driving change and strengthening the security culture across the organization.
  
**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden
  
Applications will be reviewed continuously so do not hesitate to send in your application!

title: Team Manager
description:
Vi söker för kunds räkning. För att ansöka till tjänsten, vänligen besök https://karriarguiden.se/sv/jobb/team-manager-3. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
  

Därför är detta jobb för dig
  
  

På Knightec Group tror vi på kraften i kombinationen mellan teknik och ledarskap. Som Team Manager hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att bygga och utveckla team som skapar mjukvara och teknik för fysiska produkter.Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi växer – inte bara som företag, utan som människor, tekniker och team. Det här är en roll för dig som vill arbeta både operativt och strategiskt, med ett tydligt fokus på ledarskap, kompetensutveckling och affärsdriv.
  
  

Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och snabbfotad organisation med korta beslutsvägar och stor frihet där du får utveckla både din egen kompetens och ditt ledarskap.
  
  

Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software och Cloud, där vi hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem – från inbyggda system och elektronik till datadrivna företagsapplikationer, AI och molnbaserade lösningar.
  
  

Arbetsuppgifter
  
  

Som Team Manager ansvarar du för att leda och utveckla ett team av konsulter inom affärsområdet Software och Cloud i Stockholm. Dina uppgifter spänner över att coacha individer, säkerställa god leverans till kund, bidra till rekrytering samt driva affärsutveckling.
  
  

Rollen kombinerar personalansvar med operativ närhet till kundprojekt, och du är en viktig länk mellan individ, team och organisation. I praktiken innebär det att du:
  
* Leder, coachar och utvecklar medarbetare i teamet – både genom daglig dialog och strukturerade utvecklingssamtal.
* Ansvarar för kompetensförsörjning och utveckling inom ditt team.
* Skapar en inkluderande och hållbar arbetsmiljö där medarbetare trivs och utvecklas.
* Bidrar till affären genom att initiera och driva kunddialoger, vara delaktig i försäljning och följa upp leveranser.
* Har en nyckelroll i att sätta riktning för affärsområdet tillsammans med Regional Manager och andra ledare.


Du representerar Knightec Group i dialoger med både medarbetare och kunder – och är med och driver vårt erbjudande framåt.
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:**  

* Har erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla andra, i roller där du haft ett tydligt ansvar för människor och team.
* Har en teknisk bakgrund och förståelse för teknikens möjligheter – oavsett om du tidigare jobbat med mjukvara, elektronik, automation eller annan närliggande domän.
* Vana att arbeta nära affären genom kunddialoger, presentationer och relationsbyggande.
* En högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska.


En spännande resa med Knightec Group
  
  

Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
  
  

Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
  
  

För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
  
  

Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
  
  

Praktisk information
  
  

Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm, Rättarvägen 3 (Solna United). Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
  
  

Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2025-06-30. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Albert Lindfors, Talent Acquisition Partner. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.
  
  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Recruitment Management with requirement engineering skills
description:
**Exciting Opportunity at Tekkli:**  

Join our team at Tekkli, where innovation meets expertise! We are on the hunt for a Recruitment Management profile with business analysis skills to join our dynamic team in Helsingborg. At Tekkli, we blend a creative mindset with cutting-edge technical solutions to craft world-class experiences. Dive into an environment that values change, learning, and innovative problem-solving.
  
  

**Your Role:**  

Evaluate the current legacy application, identifying opportunities for enhancement or automation.
  
Facilitate and lead workshops with local country teams, guiding discussions on Recruitment & Sourcing topics.
  
Gather, analyze, and document comprehensive business requirements, including both functional and non-functional aspects for technical services in the reqruitment field.
  
Play an active role in solution design, conducting local design sessions to walk stakeholders through the proposed solution.
  
Manage stakeholder expectations through effective communication and ensuring a clear understanding of business requirements.
  
  

**Who We Are Looking For:**  

A tech enthusiast who embraces change and is passionate about learning new technologies.
  
Strong knowledge of HR solutions.
  
Understanding of Recruitment and Onboarding processes.
  
Knowledge of Avature ATS
  
Experience working on transformation projects.
  
  

**How to Apply:**  

If you are driven, passionate about technology, and ready to contribute to our success, we would love to hear from you. Please send your CV, along with your availability and a brief introduction, to join our inspiring company. We are looking forward to your application and potentially welcoming you to our team!
  
  

**About Tekkli:**  

Tekkli is a digital transformation company driven by data, tech and human insight. Our services in strategy, digital development, data, AI and cloud & Integration allow us to work with and develop our customers into the most successful companies on the market. We believe in the long-term relationship and work accordingly, helping companies and society to renew themselves and continue their development towards the future. Within Tekkli, there is an obvious challenge that infuses the company as a whole: if there is a more intelligent solution, we will discover it.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Vi söker för kunds räkning. För att ansöka till tjänsten, vänligen besök https://karriarguiden.se/sv/jobb/cloud-architect-1. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
  

Därför är detta jobb för dig
  
  

För att du älskar att skapa system som är effektiva, kostnadseffektiva och använder en modern teknikstack. Du ser dig själv som en väsentlig del av teamet där din och teamets vision blir verklighet i molnet. Du vill göra skillnad genom att bidra med perspektiv, färdigheter och erfarenhet till olika branscher och miljöer.
  
  

Som en del av vårt team kan din resa ta olika vägar när du utvecklar system tillsammans med våra kunder. Ibland arbetar du direkt hos kunden, men oftast sker arbetet internt – alltid med målet att leverera resultat av hög kvalitet. Du kan till exempel skapa en IoT-plattform, utveckla en applikation för sensorhantering inom MedTech, eller bygga en dataplattform för industriell produktion. Exakt vilket projekt du kommer att arbeta med vet vi först när du har blivit en del av Knightec, och det är just den variationen och möjligheten att själv välja projekt som gör arbetet här så spännande!
  
  

Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software och Cloud, där vi hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem – från inbyggda system och elektronik till datadrivna företagsapplikationer, AI och molnbaserade lösningar.
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**  

* Hjälpa våra kunder redan i ett tidigt skede genom att designa lösningsarkitekturer för molnbaserade system.
* Driva kunden i rätt riktning och bidra till att öka deras kompetens inom molntjänster.
* Arbeta både med lösningsarkitektur och hands-on implementering – du jobbar gärna i gränslandet mellan arkitektur och teknik.
* Stötta och vägleda våra kunder i strategiska frågor gällande arkitektur, kostnadsoptimering och innovation.


**Kvalifikationer:**  

* Expertis inom att skapa system från idé till färdig produkt, specifikt inom Azure eller AWS.
* Förmåga att tänka på kostnader och fördelar tillsammans med hållbarheten för systemet eller produkten.
* Starka kommunikationsfärdigheter både internt och externt gällande krav, behov och tekniska val.
* Flera års erfarenhet som mjukvaruutvecklare med en examen från teknisk högskola eller universitet.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


En spännande resa med Knightec Group
  
  

Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
  
  

Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
  
  

För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
  
  

Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
  
  

Praktisk information
  
  

Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm, Rättarvägen 3 (Solna United). Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
  
  

Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2025-06-30. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Albert Lindfors, Talent Acquisition Partner. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.

title: Data Scientist in Husqvarna Groups new AI org!
description:
Vi söker för kunds räkning. För att ansöka till tjänsten, vänligen besök https://karriarguiden.se/sv/jobb/data-scientist-in-husqvarna-groups-new-ai-org. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
  

Imagine a place where your passion for technology meets the thrill of innovation. Picture yourself as part of a dynamic team, driving tangible business impact - through innovative AI solutions. Welcome to our world!
  
  

**About this opportunity:**  

This is a chance to be part of a team that's passionate about building something meaningful. The thrill of working on research projects that push the boundaries of technology, a collaborative environment where your ideas are valued and your contributions make a real impact. The opportunity to proactively drive the agenda - and shape the future of AI.
  
  

Here, we are a close-knit team of people working in data, AI and cloud, with colleagues both in India and in Sweden. Our mission? To scale AI - and pioneer forward-leading technology, ensuring we stay ahead of the curve and deliver impactful solutions.
  
  

**You will:**  

As a Data Scientist, you'll be at the heart of our innovation. You'll dive into data, build models, fine-tune algorithms, and deploy solutions in cloud environments. You'll collaborate with data architects, cloud experts, software developers and other IT specialists, weaving together your expertise - to create something extraordinary.:
  
* Develop and deliver AI solutions, including data pre-processing, analysis, modelling, deployment, and maintenance.
* Design, install, test, and maintain data management systems, to meet business requirements.
* Implement scripts for database maintenance, deployment, and ETL operations.
* Manage cloud services (AWS, Azure) and relevant cloud storage systems.
* Monitor data performance and modify infrastructure, to improve pipelines and models.
* Document feature lists, user stories, and roadmaps aligned with the product vision.
* Stay updated with technology trends in data science, data engineering, and AI.
* Execute academic and research projects relevant to the AI organization.
* Support ideation processes with technical and entrepreneurial expertise.
* Identify business opportunities through technology-driven innovation.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing activities, to elevate company expertise in AI.


**Who We're Looking For:**  

A great communicator - in the realm of technology. Maybe you’ve started your journey in software development - and found your way into the world of AI. Maybe you've worked in startups (or another innovative environment), where you didn't just code - you pitched ideas, drove innovation, and created solutions that made a difference. In any environment, you see opportunity in uncertainty, and you like to challenge yourself to learn new areas.
  
  

Your craftsmanship in writing exceptional code and delivery of high-quality products are your strengths. You're not just a coder; you are also a team-player, a communicator, an innovator, a social person - who knows how to communicate complex concepts effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
  
  

At Husqvarna, we strive to have a work environment that is inclusive and diverse, where we believe that our differences are our strengths. Therefore, our winning culture is very important to us, which is why we go by the beliefs: We are Bold, We are Dedicated and We Care.
  
  

**Your Skills and Qualifications:**  

* A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field and at least 5 years of experience in developing and delivering data and AI solutions, as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Software Developer, or similar role. Knowledge of Python, SQL
* Familiarity with big data technologies, like Spark.
* Experience leading and collaborating on cross-functional projects.
* Experience with developing prescriptive solutions to support decision making and experimentation.


**Location:**  

Location for this position is in Sweden at one of our offices in Stockholm, Huskvarna, or Jonsered (outside Gothenburg).
  
  

But, with our hybrid working environment, you'll have the flexibility to work both onsite and remotely, promoting work-life balance for all team members. We meet in the office at least 2-3 days a week (50%).
  
  

**Your application:**  

If this sounds like the adventure you’ve been waiting for, we want to hear from you! Apply as soon as possible but no later than 2025-05-30. We apply ongoing selection.
  
  

For questions regarding the process, please contact Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Matilda Nordén matilda.norden@husqvarnagroup.com. 
  
  

**About Husqvarna:**  

Husqvarna Group is a global leader in innovative solutions for managing forests, parks, and gardens, as well as cutting equipment and diamond tools for the light construction and stone industries. With an innovative mindset, we are dedicated to deliver high-quality solutions ranging from robotic mowers to chainsaws, watering systems and power cutters, with a strong focus on our customers and future generations.
  
  

Founded in the Swedish town Huskvarna in 1689, we have been pioneers in our business for more than three centuries. Today, we are mainly operating under the Husqvarna and Gardena brands, serving consumers and professionals...

title: Cloud Specialist
description:
Looking for a place where you can challenge yourself, build serious tech and have a good time doing it? At Redeploy, we design, build, scale and maintain modern solutions across Cloud, Data and AI, helping ambitious companies across the Nordics transform how they work with technology. As trusted partner to Microsoft, AWS and Databricks, we deliver platforms that are built for impact and built to last. What sets us apart is the way we work. Curiosity runs deep here, as does the drive to keep learning and sharing. You’ll join a team that values ownership, collaboration and high technical standards, and where people genuinely care about doing things well. For our clients. And for each other.
  
What the role is about As a Cloud Specialist at Redeploy, you’ll work as a consultant in projects where infrastructure, automation and scalability are in focus. You’ll help clients modernize their cloud environments in Azure or AWS – whether that means a large-scale migration, a new platform build or targeted optimization. The projects vary, but the role is always hands-on and solution-oriented. You’ll work closely with developers, architects and stakeholders to design and implement smart, cloud-native infrastructure. You’ll have plenty of ownership, but never on your own. Here, you’re part of a strong internal community where knowledge-sharing and support are part of everyday life. See some examples of cases we’ve worked with here.
  
What you’ll grow into
  
Cloud is a big space - and at Redeploy, there’s room to explore where you want to go. You might want to deepen your skills in infrastructure-as-code or specialize in areas like security, Kubernetes or FinOps. Or maybe you’re more curious about cloud architecture or moving closer to the business side. Whatever direction you’re interested in, there are opportunities to shape your path. You’ll be part of a skilled cloud community where learning happens every day - through collaboration, knowledge-sharing and hands-on experience. With strong partnerships with Microsoft and AWS, and a steady flow of events and meetups (both our own and others), we stay sharp and up to date together.
  
  

What we’re looking for You enjoy solving complex challenges, building scalable infrastructure and seeing the real impact of your work. Maybe you’ve worked as a consultant before, or maybe you’re just drawn to the mix of tech, people and problem-solving. Either way, you value variety and want to work closely with both clients and colleagues. To succeed here, you don’t just need strong technical skills - you need the mindset that comes with being a great consultant. Clear communication, curiosity and the confidence to both challenge and be challenged go a long way. And like us, you care about doing things well, together.
  
What experiences you bring
  
Strong experience working with cloud infrastructure and services in Azure, AWS or both
  
Strong knowledge of core infrastructure technologies like networking, virtualization and containerization
  
Strong experience with IaC tools such as Terraform, Bicep, CDK, Ansible or CloudFormation
  
Experience with Git and setting up CI/CD pipelines
  
A structured and analytical approach to problem-solving
  
Curiosity and willingness to learn and share knowledge with others
  
Strong communication skills in Swedish and English
  
  

Experience with Kubernetes, microservices, FinOps or cloud governance frameworks is a plus.
  
Curious to learn more before applying? Have a look around our career site to explore our culture, people and way of working. And if you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager, Francisca Andersson. Cloud Platforming is one of our core capabilities, and we recruit for this role on an ongoing basis. While our hiring pace may vary over time, we’re always happy to connect with great people.

title: Agile Release Train Architect in Data Platforms & Provisioning at Handelsbanken
description:
* *Ansök senast: 27 maj 2025*
* *Stockholm*
* *Hybrid*
***Arbetsuppgifter***
---------------------

*We are looking for an Agile Release Train Architect to lead the architectural work within one of our agile trains for Handelsbanken's shared data platforms. You will be responsible for the overall architecture and supporting the journey towards the cloud in strategic architectural matters.*  



***Your Team***  

*You will be part of the Agile Release Train (ART) leadership team, alongside the Release Train Engineer (RTE) and Chief Product Manager (CPM). You will also collaborate closely with the solution architects in the area, Business Owners, and the line organization's management team. The team is characterized by strong collaboration, where knowledge sharing and common goals are in focus. Together, we work according to agile principles, with our responsibility being to develop and maintain the Data Warehouse, BI tools, Data Governance platform, as well as to to develop the target data platform in the cloud. You will also be part of the architecture forum to find solutions together and share knowledge with other architects in the field.*  



***Your Role***  

*As an Agile Release Train Architect, you will play a crucial role in shaping and developing our shared data platforms. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining the train's target architecture. You will lead and organize the architectural work within the train and ensure that initiatives are aligned with Handelsbanken’s enterprise data strategies and target architecture. In this role, you will collaborate closely with other architects and train leadership to define and implement long-term solutions that support future business needs and technical requirements. Furthermore, you will prioritize and drive key initiatives, ensure that development initiatives follow architectural principles and design guidelines, and manage architectural deviations. As part of your work, you will coach other architects and promote skill development within the architecture team.*

***Vi har riktigt bra förmåner***
---------------------------------

* *Tjänstepension*
* *Vinstdelningssystem*
* *Gruppförsäkring*
* *Friskvårdsbidrag*
* *Bidrag vid föräldraledighet*
* *Banktjänster*
* *Banking services*
* *Benefit in connection with parental leave*
* *Health promotion subsidy*
* *Group insurance*
* *Occupational pension*
* *Profit-sharing scheme*
***Kvalifikationer***
---------------------

***Your Profile***  

*We are looking for someone with extensive experience in senior architect roles, focusing on both on-premises and modern cloud-based data platforms, as well as the challenges of on-premises to cloud transformations. You have deep knowledge in the data domain, including enterprise data warehouses, data governance with metadata-driven methodologies, data modeling, as well as modern "lake house" architectures and BI tools. With technical expertise and a solid IT background, you have also understand the long-term management perspective. Prior knowledge of AI/machine learning workflows and an understanding of data mesh principles is definitely advantageous in this role.*

*You also have experience leading other architects and business experts to ensure that architectural work is strategically aligned and of high quality. Experience with agile methodologies, preferably in large organizations, is important for success in this role. As we collaborate across the entire group, you need to be proficient in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written. Prior experience in the financial services sector is also an advantage in this role.*  



*As a person, you contribute to an inclusive work environment by embracing different perspectives but can make independent decisions when needed based on business needs and regulatory requirements. You naturally think outside the box to come up with scalable solutions. Since you will be working with many different target groups, it is critically important that you can adapt your communication and visualize proposed solutions a wide range of different stakeholders. You organize, document, and plan your work well so that you and others can follow it.*

***Welcome with your application!***

***We Offer***

* *A trusted and stable employer*
* *Exciting and challenging tasks*
* *Good work-life balance*
* *Career development opportunities*
* *Clear corporate values around social responsibility and sustainability*
* *Competitive package of staff benefits*

**Om företaget**
----------------

Hos oss får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka din egen och bankens framtida utveckling. Våra olika perspektiv, insikter och innovativa idéer utgör en grund för hur vi tillsammans bygger vidare banken för framtiden. För oss är utveckling allt och när du utvecklas, utvecklas banken.

title: Release Manager
description:
#### **About the Role**


We are looking for an engaged colleague ready to take the next internal step as Release Manager. In this role, you will lead and coordinate our release processes to ensure high quality and efficient deliveries. You already know our business and want to contribute further with your sense of structure, attention to detail, and drive to improve ways of working.


You will be responsible for releasing new versions of Mercur’s products—both for cloud-based and on-premise environments. This includes close coordination with developers, testers, and the cloud team, following up on status, managing release documentation, and ensuring that all steps in the release checklist are completed accurately and on time. A key objective is to simplify the process by reducing administration, increasing release frequency, and shortening time-to-release.

##### **Example of task assignments:**

* Monitor the stream of Jira incidents and bugs—support prioritization and ensure fixes are scheduled for relevant releases.
* Determine when a new release is needed and decide which fixes to include.
* Set check-in bans to prevent additional changes close to release.
* Build new release versions and create standardized MSI packages.
* Document new releases in Confluence and Jira.
* Coordinate releases for both cloud and on-premise environments.
* Follow up on release steps and ensure all checklist items are completed.
* Communicate with developers, testers, and the operations team to ensure smooth and predictable deliveries.
* Maintain and improve documentation and routines related to release management.

##### **We are looking for someone who:**

* Is meticulous—an advocate for tidiness and structure.
* Has at least moderate knowledge of Mercur’s current offering.
* Collaborates well and communicates clearly.
* Enjoys working independently and takes initiative to improve processes.
* Is fluent in both Swedish and English.

##### **Practical Information:**

* Scope: 50%
* Start date: At your earliest convenience


For more information about the role, please contact Johan Lindemann.

 ***The application for this position will close on Friday May 16th.***

title: Principal Enterprise Account Manager, AWS Enterprise Sales
description:
•Extensive experience as a quota carrying technology field sales individual and Extensive experience working with large Enterprises
•Proven track record selling transformational projects and solutions and experience increasing technology adoption and creating long term transformational account strategies
•Experience working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and other lines of business
•Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise Customers
  

Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing adoption of Amazon Web Services by developing enterprise accounts? Do you have the business savvy and the technical background necessary to help establish Amazon as a key technology platform provider?
As an Enterprise Account Manager you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of an emerging technology. Your responsibilities will include driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration in enterprise accounts. The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and technical background that enables them to drive an engagement at the CXO level as well as with software developers and IT architects. You should also be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on annual revenue targets.
Come build the future with us.
AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
Key job responsibilities
• Drive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry vertical
• Meet or exceed annual revenue targets
•Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan
•Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services
•Accelerate customer adoption
•Maintain a robust sales pipeline
•Work with extended teams and partners to extend reach & drive adoption
•Manage contract negotiations
•Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
•Ensure customer satisfaction
•Expect moderate travel
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
  

* Experience developing, negotiating and executing business agreements experience
* Experience in one or more of the following industry sectors: Retail, M&E, Industrial/Manufacturing, Energy, Mining, Security, Financial Services


•Direct experience in customer-facing role interacting with multinational customer organizations. • Understanding of Cloud Services and Content delivery  

* Deep experience in satellite communications technologies and value adds

  

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
