title: Email and Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
**Vill du vara med och revolutionera eventbranschen som en del av vårt kreativa digitala team?** Är du en passionerad marknadsförare med hjärta för smart, datadriven kommunikation och brinner för att skapa tillväxt genom riktigt vassa e-mailkampanjer? Då kan du vara den vi letar efter!

**Din roll som Email Marketing Automation Specialist på Easyfairs Nordic**  

Vi söker en driven och analytisk person som vill ta vår e-postmarknadsföring till nästa nivå. I rollen som Email Marketing Automation Specialist blir du vår go-to-expert inom email och marketing automation i Norden och den som förvandlar insikter och data till konverterande kampanjer.


Du kommer att arbeta hands-on i Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) med allt från att bygga automatiserade kundresor till att designa och optimera mallar, analysera resultat och ständigt söka nya sätt att skapa engagemang

**Du kommer bland annat att:**

* Implementera effektiva strategier för email- och marketing automation.
* Skapa responsiva mallar enligt best practise och våra brand guidelines
* Utföra A/B testning och optimera därefter för att maximera öppningsfrekvens, klick och konverteringar
* Utbilda och stötta kollegor i deras användning av Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Säkerställa att vi håller högsta nivå och följer best practise i regionen inom email- och marketing automation
* Analysera, rapportera och föreslå förbättringar med fokus på CTR, CTO, OR och CR

**Vem är du?**

* Du har minst 2 års erfarenhet av resultatinriktat arbete med email och marketing automation
* Du är en van användare av Salesforce Marketing Cloud eller liknande plattform
* Du har koll på grunderna inom HTML och CSS och förstår hur man bygger emails som fungerar i alla inkorgar
* Du är en självgående doer som inte tvekar att ta egna initiativ och aktivt söker lösningar när du stöter på utmaningar.
* Du har en god känsla för att tolka data och kan dra insikter som hjälper dig att fatta smarta beslut.
* Du är en god kommunikatör som värdesätter dina kollegor och arbetsrelationer
* Du pratar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska.

**Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet av Litmus eller liknande verktyg
* Grundläggande kunskaper i SQL och AMPscript

**Vi erbjuder**

* Tjänstepension
* 6 veckors semester + 2 extra valbara dagar
* Friskvårdsbidrag + Friskvårdstimme varje vecka
* Bonusmöjlighet
* Hybridarbete
* Årlig kick-off och löpande teamsaktiviteter

**Därför ska du välja Easyfairs**  

Easyfairs är ett dynamiskt och energifyllt företag med över 870 teammedlemmar runt om i Europa. Hos oss är det inte bara erfarenhet som räknas, vi värdesätter även personliga egenskaper, idéer och viljan att utvecklas. Vi tror på frihet under ansvar och älskar att ha roligt tillsammans längs vägen!


Läs mer om oss: https://www.easyfairs.com/

**Redo att söka?** Vår rekryteringsprocess pågår löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Önskvärt är att du bifogar ditt CV och personliga brev på engelska - då kandidater i processen även kan komma att intervjuas av vårt HQ i Bryssel.

title: Business Development Manager (UK & Nordics)
description:
**Purpose of the position**



The Business Development Manager (BDM) role is a member of the European Commercial organization and drives the growth of high margin, “command center” products within the European region.

  




* The BDM has responsibility to understand specific customer needs for Command Centre - high margin Solutions, typically Retail systems like Point of Sale (POS), Back Office Systems (BOS) and Head Office systems (HOS), Outdoor Payment Terminals (OPT), Payment Platforms (PMT), Forecourt Controllers (FCC) and Advanced Cloud Services (AS), to drive sales together with the regional commercial teams.

  




* The BDM will work with the regional sales teams, with Marketing and Engineering as well as with various other internal functions to define the solution to be proposed, and consequently implement the sales strategy for the specific market/customer owning the related commercial activities needed to generate new sales.



**Key Responsibilities**


* Ensure the Order intake for the target product lines and customers:

o Primary focus on the target accounts and countries

o Secondarily the support of further business opportunities and order Intake within target markets in Europe and to lead the retail expansion into new territories.
* Establish Gilbarco Veeder-Root as credible retail solutions player in Europe, also with for the longer term, by:



o Participating to applicable Retail Solutions tenders

o To create, agree and implement the tactical and long-term sales strategy, for assigned territory


o Presenting the Retail Solutions portfolio to customers

o Building relations with key stakeholders in existing/new accounts and partners

o Responsible for maintaining and creating the required channel network to support GVR retail business within assigned territory for coverage and needed complementary offerings that might help to penetrate and support certain markets or accounts with key solutions.  


* Defines and validates the best solution for the customer



o Builds and maintains relations with customers to collect and negotiate solution requirements

o Outlines the solution with its elements in a way to clearly communicate with customers, internally and with 3rd parties involved, including high level design, Statement of Work and Bill of Materials.

o Validates with the involved product Center Of Excellence (COE) the gaps vs customer requirements hence the costs and effort required to close them, as well as the feasibility and the alignment with the roadmap.

o Collaborates to create and execute opportunity plans and account development plans to introduce or expand Retail Solutions into the sales mix.  


* Drives and Supports commercial activities

o Establish as a market expert and creates an advisory relation with key customer stakeholders, developing long lasting and high-quality business relationships by instilling trust and confidence.

o Leverages on material from the regional marketing team to deliver solution sales presentation to customers and partners..

o Supports and/or executes commercial demos, exhibitions, VOCs and presentations.

o Develops value proposition for specific customers and designs the customer offer.
o Drives presentations, commercial offers and RFI/RFQ responses providing the right positioning for the proposed solution.

o Educate customers and partners on the solutions portfolio and its values
o Lead and delivers, hands on, commercial workshops, trials and other pre-sales activities  


* Understands and processes market needs



o Provides input to VOC activities led by the marketing organization.

o Collects market drivers and specific requirements from any source to prepare for Sales strategy and any product customization, localization or feature development that may be required.

o Organizes and maintains a knowledge base of competitors’ solutions for proper benchmark in collaboration with the product marketing team  


* Inputs to the product development roadmap for the target market

o Stays continually in informed about relevant market and regulatory trends, to factor them into the solution design.

o Conveys market intelligence to the marketing function to feed the product improvement processes

o Develops and submits requirements to the European Product Planning Group (PPG) and has ownership for initial milestones (MS-0 and MS-1) submissions for what concerns Retail Solutions.**Knowledge, Skills and Experience**


**Required skills: Education, Experience / knowledge, Role specific skills**



Self-motivated, influencer. with capabilities of synthesis and analysis. Team worker. A doer who isn’t scared to get hands dirty with details and operative tasks when needed but can still see and manage the big picture and report to C-level, internal and external, adapting the communication to the context. Likes an International multi-cultural environment and is ready to travel as needed.

  


* Presentation skills (to engage and present up to C-level suite)
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and an ability to motivate and manage at all levels, specifically regarding “mixed” teams and heterogeneous customer groups.


* Consultancy skills – is able to influence and advise the customer due to established relationships and an in-depth knowledge of the customer’s business
* Ability to create and convey a vision and to identify strategic opportunities.


* Negotiation skills (to negotiate up to large business terms)


* Contracting / legal skills (to draft and negotiate contracts)


* Fuel retail business background or experience
* Experience in sales management, account management and complex sales

**WHO IS** **INVENCO by GVR**



Invenco by GVR is a dynamic and innovative force in the technology-driven retail solutions. Born from integrating groups within the Gilbarco Veeder-Root network and the strategic acquisition of technology companies worldwide, our foundation is built on tech expertise. With a diverse set of industry leaders including Orpak, Invenco, Insite360 & GVR, we have formed a network of excellence. Our team members are located in over 20 countries and we are proud of the global diversity of our teams.

**WHO IS VONTIER**



Vontier (NYSE: VNT) is a global industrial technology company uniting productivity, automation and multi-energy technologies to meet the needs of a rapidly evolving, more connected mobility ecosystem. Leveraging leading market positions, decades of domain expertise and unparalleled portfolio breadth, Vontier enables the way the world moves – delivering smart, safe and sustainable solutions to our customers and the planet. Vontier has a culture of continuous improvement and innovation built upon the foundation of the Vontier Business System and embraced by colleagues worldwide. Additional information about Vontier is available on the Company’s website at www.vontier.com.


**At Vontier, we empower you to steer your career in the direction of success with a dynamic, innovative, and inclusive environment.**



Our commitment to personal growth, work-life balance, and collaboration fuels a culture where your contributions drive meaningful change. We provide the roadmap for continuous learning, allowing creativity to flourish and ideas to accelerate into impactful solutions that contribute to a sustainable future.



Join our community of passionate people who work together to navigate challenges and seize opportunities. At Vontier, you are not on this journey alone-we are dedicated to equipping you with the tools and support needed to fuel your innovation, lead with impact, and thrive both personally and professionally.


**Together, let’s enable the way the world moves!**

title: Moln- och säkerhetsspecialist till NetNordic
description:
**Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnplattformar?** **NetNordic söker nu erfarna specialister och utvecklare med fokus på Azure, Microsoft 365 och cloud security. Här får du jobba i långsiktiga kundrelationer där tekniskt djup, innovation och tillit står i centrum. Vi jobbar projektbaserat men stannar kvar och skapar mervärde – långt efter att migreringen är klar.**

**Att jobba inom Cloud & Security på NetNordic**


Hos oss får du arbeta i spetsen av Azure Cloud-utveckling, migrering, säkerhet och forensik. Vi hanterar hela livscykeln – från molnstrategi och arkitektur till implementation, övervakning och optimering. Du kommer att bli en del av ett team som kombinerar teknisk excellens med kommersiellt tänk, och där stark kundnärvaro och långsiktiga relationer är nyckeln.


Vi har fyra expertteam – Azure-arkitekter, M365-specialister, ett kommersiellt team och ett utvecklingsteam – som tillsammans löser komplexa utmaningar för våra kunder.

**Vi jobbar bland annat med:**

* **Azure Cloud**  

Migrering, optimering, kostnadseffektivisering, säkerhet
* **Microsoft 365**  

Säkerhet, dokumentklassificering, policys, compliance
* **Cloud Security & Forensik**  

Säkerhetsdesign, incidenthantering, återställning
* **SOC – Security Operation Center**  

24/7-övervakning och incidenthantering
* **Center of Excellence**  

T.ex. vid företagsöverlåtelser eller större plattformsbyten
* **Licenshantering**  

CSP-modellen för Azure och Microsoft 365


Vi har t.ex. hjälpt kunder att sänka sin Azure-konsumtion med 15 % – en konkret effekt av vår kunskap och våra optimeringsmetoder.

 **Vi söker dig som:**

* Har **flera års erfarenhet** av Azure eller Microsoft 365-miljöer
* Har god teknisk förståelse för **cloudarkitektur**, migrering och säkerhet
* Är nyfiken, självgående och har ett **kommersiellt öga**
* Talar och skriver **flytande svenska**
* Har erfarenhet av någon av följande roller:
* + **Azure-utvecklare**
	+ **Cloud Solutions Architect (Azure)**
	+ **Senior Business Developer / Projektledare**
	+ **Licensspecialist (CSP)**
	+ **Microsoft-inriktad säljare (Solution Selling)**

**Ansökan**


Låter detta som rätt nästa steg för dig? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt – urval sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen eller NetNordic, kontakta gärna Micho på micho.shek@netnordic.com

**Om NetNordic**


NetNordic är en ledande nordisk systemintegratör som specialiserar sig på tjänster och lösningar för verksamhetskritisk infrastruktur inom cybersäkerhet, moln, nätverk, data analytics och samarbetslösningar. Företaget grundades 2001 och har vuxit både organiskt och genom strategiska förvärv. Idag har NetNordic över 700 anställda och samarbetare med över 3 000 kunder i Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Finland.


I Sverige är NetNordic representerat genom NetNordic Sweden AB, med huvudkontor i Solna och ytterligare kontor i Askim, Malmö och Umeå. Kontoret i Askim kommer att flytta till nya, moderna lokaler i Mölndal under hösten 2025.


NetNordic arbetar nära med marknadsledande teknikleverantörer och har ett starkt fokus på att leverera högkvalitativa och tillförlitliga tjänster till både privata och offentliga kunder. NetNordics vision är att vara sina kunders "Best Companion" i den digitala transformationen, vilket innebär att de strävar efter att vara en pålitlig partner som hjälper kunderna att anpassa sina operativa processer till sina strategiska mål.


För mer information: NetNordic

title: Rack Install Technician, Infrastructure Delivery
description:

- Knowledge of server systems and power infrastructure
- Ability to work in various positions (working on ladders, etc)

We are seeking a skilled Rack Install Technician to join our Infrastructure Delivery team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the installation and cabling of server racks.

Key job responsibilities

About the team
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. Inclusive Team Culture

Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
  

* Experience with fiber optic installations

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. title: IT Operations Specialist
description:
**Hemnet is looking for a curious and hands-on IT Operations Specialist to help strengthen and evolve our internal IT capabilities. In this role, you'll improve user experiences, drive security-focused initiatives, and ensure our systems and devices enable smooth, secure, and effective work across the company.** 
  

  

**Our IT Mission** 
  

  

 The IT team at Hemnet supports the company with technical assistance and administration, working to create a seamless IT environment that enables and supports Hemnet's continued growth journey.
   

  

**About The Role** 
  

  

 As an IT Operations Specialist, you’ll be part of our small but impactful internal IT team, working closely with our Head of Internal IT and System Administrator. This is a hands-on, user-facing role with a strong focus on continuous improvement, security, access management, and evolving our SaaS environment as we grow.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in shaping how we work with internal IT – refining tools like Google Workspace, improving security practices, and leading initiatives that strengthen our internal tech and employee experience. You’ll work both reactively and proactively: solving immediate issues while also identifying patterns and driving long-term improvements.
   

  

 You’ll also collaborate with various teams, including Information Security and DevOps, particularly around identity management, secure integrations, and access control.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities** 
  

  

**IT Operations & Security** 
  

  

* Maintain and improve the performance and security of Hemnet’s internal IT environment
* Drive internal IT initiatives with a focus on usability, scale, and safety
* Ensure compliance with security practices across our internal IT environment – including areas such as MFA, device compliance and access controls – while continuously identifying opportunities to raise the level of security across our IT environment
* Participate in onboarding/offboarding processes and lifecycle management of accounts and devices


  

  

**Asset & License Management** 
  

  

* Manage and track hardware and software inventory
* Ensure efficient license use and procurement compliance
* Streamline device setup through automation and MDM (e.g. Jamf)


  

  

**Internal IT Support, Administration & Collaboration** 
  

  

* Together with the System Administrator, provide internal IT support to employees, including troubleshooting, access management and onboarding
* Improve and maintain SaaS integrations (e.g. Google Workspace, Slack)
* Collaborate with InfoSec and DevOps to implement practical security improvements across tools and workflows
* Maintain documentation and actively share knowledge across Hemnet


  

  

**What We Are Looking For** 
  

  

 We’re looking for someone who’s proactive, helpful, and technically sharp – but also thrives in a collaborative and informal environment. You enjoy balancing everyday problem-solving with driving long-term improvements, and you’re motivated by creating a smooth and secure experience for everyone at Hemnet.
   

  

**You likely recognize yourself in many of the following:** 
  

  

* Experience working with internal IT in a SaaS-based environment, especially with Google Workspace
* Solid understanding of IT security practices such as SSO, MFA, access control and compliance
* A structured, self-driven approach and clear communication with both end users and technical teams


  

  

**What We Offer** 
  

  

* A tight-knit, helpful team with short decision paths and high trust
* A chance to grow and shape internal IT at a product-focused tech company
* Freedom to take initiative and push improvements
* A collaborative culture where your work truly matters


  

  

**🛑 Application for this role will be closed on May 5th** 
  

  

****🏡** 
 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 Are you ready to play a meaningful role in one of the biggest decisions people make in life? If so – welcome to Hemnet! Since 1998, we’ve taken pride in making the life-changing, often stressful journey of finding a new home as smooth and enjoyable as possible.
   

  

 At Hemnet, our mission is to connect every seller with every buyer, empower buyers to discover every home for sale, and enable real estate agents to match seamlessly with sellers. With over 40 million monthly visits, we’re Sweden’s most popular property platform and the first choice for Swedes looking to buy or sell a home. Together, we’re creating an open, transparent housing market, making home transactions in Sweden among the most efficient in the world.
   

  

 Our success is built on a strong, friendly culture that values creativity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Hemnet is a place where everyone has a voice, and our welcoming environment helps you thrive and grow as you work alongside passionate colleagues from around the globe.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Marketing & Content Interns
description:
**Company Description**
  

 Devoteam G Cloud is an award-winning Google Cloud partner known for its innovative and collaborative culture. With a team of over 600 Google Cloud experts, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to businesses across the globe. Our Stockholm office is a hub for creativity and technological advancement.
   

  

  

**Job Description**
  

 We're looking for talented interns to join our team in
 **Stockholm** 
 this spring (

 ). Are you passionate about content, SEO, and design? Or do you thrive in the fast-paced world of marketing and events? We have exciting opportunities in two key areas:

 Boost your skills in content creation, SEO, design, and event planning. Contribute to blog posts, social media content, website updates, and more.

 Dive into social media management, email campaigns, market analysis, and event coordination. Help us reach new audiences and promote our services.

**Apply Now!**

title: Digital Strategy Group - Engagement Manager
description:
**Our Company**
 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
   

  

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   

  

**The challenge:**
 Adobe’s Digital Strategy Group works with C-level leadership at leading companies to advise on digital strategy and transformation for customer-centric experiences, audience monetization and digital innovation. Adobe has long been at the forefront of enabling customers on digital transformation, customer-centric experiences and data-driven innovation across industries.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As an Engagement Manager in the DSG team, you will lead strategy consulting engagements for the world’s leading brands, primally for Retail and CPG companies. You will work directly with Adobe’s sales, marketing, partner, and customer success functions to drive demand and handle the pipeline of DX Strategy engagements. You will also work with sales and customer teams to find opportunities and nurture deals to close.
   

  

 For each engagement, you will collaborate with a team of specialists to conduct analyses, develop insights, and deliver impactful recommendations. You will help customers (from CXOs to practitioners) realise the return on investment of their prospective Adobe partnership by developing and communicating a roadmap to value. You will advise senior industry leaders and apply your experience to become a trusted advisor to clients and a thought leader on trends, digital innovation, use cases for Adobe technology, and relevant research in your industry.
   

  

 At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world by numerous “best places to work” awards. We are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to build your career, Adobe’s the place for you. Every day, we get to work with some of the most creative, analytical, authentic and inspiring people in the world.
   

  

**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* Seven to 10 years recent (last five years) hands-on experience of working in a retail or consumer products business. This could have been in a marketing, ecommerce, data or customer experience team. You’ve been there, done that and as a result have a high degree of knowledge and empathy for clients and the problems they need to solve to be successful
* Experience in leading consulting engagements with a structured problem-solving approach is ideal but not required
* Expertise in crafting digital experience, marketing, or monetization strategies in the Retail/CPG industries along with a high-level understanding of marketing technologies and tactics needed for execution
* Partner with individuals, internal and external, across all levels
* Knowledge of MarTech ecosystem and Adobe Experience Cloud solutions ideal
* Executive presence and client communication skills, with ability to engage and inspire senior leaders
* Outstanding structured problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills including talent for conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and crafting effective recommendations focused on the highest-value opportunities
* High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb new concepts quickly
* Both English and local language at fluent level
* Ability to travel up to 30%


 As our many awards will tell you, at Adobe you’ll be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You’ll be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog, https://blog.adobe.com/en/topics/adobe-life and explore the fantastic benefits we offer at Rewards.adobe.com.
   

  

 Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire dedicated individuals, regardless of gender, race or colour, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All.
   

  

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   

  

 Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.
   

  

 Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.
   

  

 Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

title: Product Manager AWS
description:
G+D makes the lives of billions of people around the world more secure. We shape trust in the digital age with built-in security tech in three segments: Digital Security, Financial Platforms and Currency Technology. We have been a reliable partner for our customers for over 170 years with our innovative solutions for SecurityTech! We are an international technology group and traditional family business with over 14,000 employees in 40 countries. Creating Confidence is our path to success. Trust is the basis of our collaboration within G+D.
   

  

 We are the reliable partner for all challenges resulting from the Internet of Things. We offer a complete connectivity portfolio for mobile network operators, automotive manufacturers, technology companies such as chip and module manufacturers as well as transport and logistics providers. Our portfolio includes highly secure solutions in the area of connectivity & IoT, from classic SIM, eSIM and iSIM, to the associated embedded operating systems and life cycle management, through to services for global connectivity and IoT solutions. Do you want to actively shape the digital transformation with us?
   

  

 Give yourself an outstanding opportunity to develop and form your career in a dynamic and international environment. We are now looking for an Product Manager with focus on cloud transformation in AWS to join us at G+D Mobile Security for a permanent position based in Stockholm.
   

  

 Join our team in managing cutting-edge B2B software products and solutions that foster a seamless, connected society. Trusted by leading global brands in telecommunications, automotive, and IoT, our solutions set industry standards. As a Product Manager AWS, you will drive the development of innovative business models for new digital offerings, with a focus on Cloud Transformation in AWS.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 We are looking for a Product Manager with strong AWS expertise, cloud migration experience, and knowledge of IoT and eSIM technologies to drive transformational projects and optimize our cloud infrastructure. In this role you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Leading the product lifecycle from ideation to launch, ensuring seamless transitions.
* Innovate business models for new digital offerings and support it with business cases.
* Craft and execute product strategies that drive sustainable growth.
* Transform business vision into product reality by understanding market dynamics and customer needs.
* Design product concepts, manage backlogs, develop roadmaps, and coordinate agile plans with cross-functional teams.
* Prioritize and review requirements to ensure market acceptance and customer value.
* Drive successful product development and growth initiatives to meet market, technical, financial and schedule requirements.


**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a dynamic leader with exceptional communication skills and with a strong commercial mindset. The Product Manager will be guiding the team into the cloud environment, which involves inspiring and motivating the team, delivering presentations and staying attuned to market trends. Moreover, you need to have:
   

  

* University or Master's degree in Engineering, Economics, or Computer Science.
* Experience in Product Management or related roles in Software Engineering or Solution Architecture within IT, Software, or Telecommunications.
* Proven experience in product management for B2B software solutions
* Expertise in major cloud providers, especially AWS Marketplace
* Proficiency in Business English


 It is extra good if you have:
   

  

* Cloud provider certifications in AWS
* Experience using AI in a business context


 Do you want to contribute to build the future for a seamless and connected society? Then apply today!
   

  

**What can we offer you?**
 In this role you will have the opportunity to work with talented people in an international and innovative environment. G+D is a well-established family-owned company at the forefront of the market. Besides a dynamic and evolving industry, we offer you:
   

  

* Annual wellness allowance of 4500 SEK
* Three additional days off per year
* Weekly sport activity hour
* Collective agreement
* Access to the Benify Portal for health activities and discounts
* Skandia health insurance
* Vacation exchange program
* Hybrid office model with the option to work 50% from home
* Weekly breakfast at the office


 Get to know us and our team at G+D Sweden better by listening to our Jobcast below:Shaping the next chapter of the digital ageSpotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/71GyhbDv090LgVyukyLf7v?si=f399b1f0d93e47e3
   

  

 Acast: https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e072f95211700118d82a4Our DNA is in our peopleSpotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/6BpWiUCMXr3q68dSGEr2w7?si=e4328a3c8db34b8d
   

  

 Acast: https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e070580b8d100110f0e95

title: Customer Solutions Architect
description:
**Job Title:** 
 (Customer)
 
 Solutions Architect
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





**About Vionlabs** 




 Vionlabs is an AI-driven company revolutionizing content discovery and user engagement in the media and entertainment industry. Our metadata enrichment solutions help streaming services, broadcasters, and media companies deliver highly personalized recommendations and search experiences to their audiences.
 



  





**Your Role** 




 We are looking for an Solution Architect to join our team and play a crucial role in onboarding and integrating our AI-powered solutions with our customers. You’ll be responsible for translating business requirements into technical solutions and will collaborate closely with product managers, developers, and external stakeholders to connect multiple systems and ensure seamless integrations in a cloud-native, distributed environment. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, problem-solving, and ensuring seamless customer experiences.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities** 



* Lead technical implementations of Vionlabs’ products for new and existing customers.
* Drive end-to-end system integrations using RESTful APIs and modern architectural patterns.
* Collaborate with Sales, Customer Success, Engineering, and Product teams to translate business needs into scalable technical solutions.
* Design and document solution architectures for integrations, new features, and customer-specific use cases.
* Define data flows and system interactions using UML or similar modeling standards.
* Deploy and scale solutions using cloud platforms (primarily GCP and AWS) and containerized environments (Kubernetes).
* Ensure reliability, security, and performance across distributed system environments.
* Support internal and external technical teams throughout implementation and troubleshooting processes.
* Monitor implementations and resolve issues in a timely and proactive manner.
* Provide customer training and support to enable effective use of Vionlabs’ solutions.
* Analyze customer usage data and recommend optimizations to maximize product value.



  





**Your Skills** 




**Required Skills & Experience** 



* 2+ years of experience in a Solution Architect or similar technical role.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical topics for non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive mindset for identifying and resolving issues.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and customer implementations in parallel with attention to detail and prioritization.
* Expertise in RESTful APIs with a deep understanding of API design, integration, and security.
* Proven experience in system integration, especially involving multiple internal and external systems in SaaS or data-rich environments.
* Proficiency in architectural documentation, including UML or similar diagramming standards to clearly communicate system design and data flows.
* Solid grasp of cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Amazon Web Services (AWS).
* Strong understanding of distributed systems, including asynchronous workflows, service orchestration, and data processing.
* Solid networking fundamentals, including VPNs, Firewalls, and IP-based communication.
* Edge Processing: Hands-on experience designing or deploying solutions in constrained environments (e.g., limited compute, offline mode).
* Basic to intermediate coding skills in Python or comparable scripting languages, especially for backend services or workflow automation.



  





**Nice to Have** 



* Background or domain knowledge in media, video, or streaming platforms
* Experience with iPaaS platforms such as Workato, Zapier, or similar tools.
* Foundational knowledge of Kubernetes, including container orchestration and deployment principles.
* Familiarity with DevSecOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* The opportunity to work at the forefront of AI and media technology.
* A collaborative and fast-paced environment where your contributions make an impact.
* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Hybrid work flexibility.
* Growth opportunities in an expanding company.



  





**Apply Now** 




  





 If you’re passionate about technology and customer success, and you enjoy working at the intersection of AI, data, and media, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





 Apply now to join Vionlabs and help shape the future of content discovery.

title: Senior Customer Success Manager
description:
MongoDB’s mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhere—on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, it’s no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
   

  

 The role:
   

  

 We are looking for a motivated, hardworking and hands-on Senior Customer Success Manager (CSM) to help our customers realize and improve the value of their MongoDB subscription and services.
   

  

 Individuals in this role have a passion for technology and the ambition to dive head-first into new challenges; are adaptive and excited to help innovate with new processes and contribute to what’s already been built. We’re looking for someone who thrives by having daily interactions with customers.
   

  

 The Customer Success team at MongoDB is responsible for establishing relationships and becoming a trusted advisor and “go-to” person for standard methodologies and advice. We are an integral part of our customer’s success with MongoDB and bring value to every interaction - from onboarding and product adoption to growth.
   

  

 We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Stockholm for our flexible work model.
   

  

 Our ideal candidate will have:
   

  

* 7-10 years relevant experience working in a Customer Success, Account Management, or similar customer-focused role
* 4 + years Experience with large-scale, technologically sophisticated accounts and/or Enterprise market customers in a fast paced SaaS environment
* 2+ years of technical product experience or education
* Bachelor's degree, technical degree preferred
* A mind for technology! We’ll teach you all about MongoDB and databases, but our customers and product are inherently technical and you should have an aptitude and curiosity to learn about those concepts
* Prior exposure to database, cloud and infrastructure technology is a plus
* High levels of organization in your workflows - you understand what it means to be responsible for a customer portfolio and to prioritize your time efficiently
* A passion for partnership and collaboration! You’ll be working with multiple teams on a regular basis (Sales, Marketing, Support, Product, etc) and will help to build the CS “brand” across our entire organization
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present to a diverse audience, both internally and externally
* Swedish native / Fluent is required as well as English


 Position Expectations:
   

  

* Build active and meaningful relationships with customers, working closely with other MongoDB partners
* Lead new customer and project onboarding meetings, validating and identifying customer needs, potential challenges, and key project timelines
* Promote and encourage implementation of paid MongoDB features across your assigned customer portfolio
* Optimally identify and mitigate risk of churn
* Ensure high customer satisfaction and referenceability
* Help to develop and implement standard methodologies, processes, and tools to continually improve MongoDB’s Customer Success Program


 As a Sr. CSM, you will be successful when you can become a(n):
   

  

* Risk Mitigator - identifying blockers to success and preventing long term churn
* Personal Trusted Advisor - recommending standard methodologies in order to make the client successful
* Account Strategist - helping MongoDB see where the customer’s business is going
* Business Builder - finding opportunities for your customers to adopt new features and open new use cases


 To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!
   

  

 MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.
   

  

 MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer
   

  

 Req ID - 1263093331

title: Head of Delivery
description:
*Hos oss hittar du ett gäng med hjärta för både teknik och affär – och nu behöver vårt team i Stockholm en ledare som vill ta ansvar för allt från trivsel och utveckling till leverans och struktur. Vi är specialiserade på NetSuite – ett molnbaserat affärssystem – och hjälper några av Nordens mest spännande tillväxtbolag att växa ännu smartare genom att optimera finansiell styrning, operativ effektivitet och datadrivet beslutsfattande.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Här blir du en nyckelperson på vårt Stockholmskontor – med fullt personalansvar för ett team på 14 personer med olika erfarenhetsnivåer. Våra inhouse-konsulter arbetar nära kunder inom främst tech, SaaS och e-handel, där vi skapar skräddarsydda lösningar med verklig affärsnytta.
 



 Du ansvarar för deras utveckling, och skapar en miljö där människor mår bra, växer och presterar. Ditt uppdrag? Att coacha både individ och grupp – för oss är båda lika viktiga. Du skapar struktur och riktning för teamet som helhet, samtidigt som du är nära varje medarbetare och anpassar ditt ledarskap efter deras behov och drivkrafter. Parallellt har du koll på beläggning, trivsel och leverans. Du äger det operativa resultatet för teamet, allokerar resurser smart och arbetar proaktivt med att lyfta både kapacitet och kompetens. Du blir också en viktig del av ledningsgruppen, där du representerar både teamet och Stockholmskontoret i stort.
 



  





**Urval av arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Leder, coachar och utvecklar både teamet som helhet och varje individ utifrån deras behov
* Säkerställer smart resursfördelning – rätt person på rätt plats, vid rätt tillfälle
* Följer upp beläggning, kostnader och teamets leverans med fokus på balans och resultat
* Delaktig i rekryteringar, introducerar och vägleder nya medarbetare med en tydlig plan för framgång
* Bidrar aktivt till bolagets riktning och utveckling genom ditt arbete i ledningsgruppen



  





**Vi söker dig som är..** 




 En närvarande ledare som trivs med att vara mitt i verksamheten, bygga relationer och driva teamet framåt med tydlighet, struktur och engagemang. Samtidigt har du alltid helheten i sikte: du förstår kopplingen mellan välmående, prestation och affär, samt arbetar proaktivt för att teamet ska bidra till både kundvärde och lönsamhet. Du tänker långsiktigt, är van vid att ta ansvar för resultat och har ett strategiskt öga för vad som krävs för att verksamheten ska utvecklas. Som ledare vet du vikten av att vara lyhörd, coachande och har en naturlig förmåga att skapa förtroende – både i teamet och i ledningsgruppen. Och ja – du är också en person som bidrar till att jobbet inte bara blir gjort, utan också blir roligt på vägen.
 



  





**Om önskemålen** 
 :
 


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att leda team med goda resultat
* Erfarenhet av ERP och IT-konsultbranschen (inhouse-konsulter)
* Tidigare erfarenhet av budgetansvar och ledningsgruppsarbete
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, ekonomi eller annat relevant område
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Om oss** 




 Hos oss på
 **Noresca** 
 får du stort eget ansvar, engagerade kollegor och möjligheten att vara en del av ett stabilt, växande Gasellbolag med hjärtat på rätt ställe. Vi grundades 2017 och är idag 34 personer fördelade mellan våra kontor i Stockholm och Göteborg. Med fokus på både kundnöjdhet och medarbetartrivsel har vi byggt en kultur där människor trivs och stannar – något vi är extra stolta över att våra medarbetarundersökningar och kundomdömen bekräftar.
 



 Vi gillar att ha roligt tillsammans och arrangerar regelbundet sociala aktiviteter – från frukostar och AW:s till konferensresor i Sverige och utomlands. Vi värdesätter balans mellan jobb och privatliv, och erbjuder en flexibel arbetsmiljö där du får vara med och påverka – på riktigt.
 



  





**START** 
 : Enligt överenskommelse
 



**PLATS** 
 : Stockholm, Convendum Drottninggatan
 



**OMFATTNING** 
 : Heltid
 



**LÖN** 
 : Fast lön
 



**KONTAKT** 
 : Senior Talent Manager, mikaela.ehk@oddwork.se (för frågor om tjänsten, ej ansökningar)
 



**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM** 
 : Urval sker löpande
 



  





 This recruitment process is powered by Teamtailor on behalf of Oddwork. By applying for this role, you confirm that we store your personal data to be able to process the job application. Follow the link to read the Privacy Policy and learn more about what type of personal information we collect and how we use and protect such information: jobb.oddwork.se/pages/teamtailor-gdpr

title: Enterprise Sales Director Sweden
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Picture Yourself At Pega**
 Imagine leading a dynamic team at Pegasystems, where innovation meets excellence. As the Director of Sales (Enterprise) for the Nordics, you’ll be a pivotal leader and key addition to the Central (DACH & Nordics) Management team. Since 2008, Pega has been revolutionising the customer journey for millions, working with well-known clients in the region, leveraging cutting-edge technology. Pega is The Enterprise Transformation Company™ that empowers organisations to Build for Change® with groundbreaking enterprise AI decisioning and workflow automation solutions. This unique opportunity involves hiring and coaching a world-class enterprise sales team, developing pipelines, strategic planning, account management, accurate forecasting, and consistently achieving defined sales quotas within the MEDDPICC qualification framework.
   

  

**Meet Our Team**
 Join a team that is at the forefront of industry transformation. As the recognized leader in strategic business application by analysts such as Forrester and Gartner, we challenge companies to rethink their business models and empower them to become more efficient, smarter, and customer-centric.
   

  

 Our Nordics Go-To-Market team is centered around our Stockholm office. We work in a hybrid model, offering the flexibility to work from home, client sites, or at our Stockholm office, while regularly connecting with your team to achieve outstanding results together.
   

  

**What You'll Do At Pega**
**Lead, Inspire & Empower** 
 your team to reach their full potential by listening, empowering, and driving accountability through empathetic leadership. Foster a collaborative, high-trust culture of top achievers, emphasizing OnePega sales engagement and a strong learning environment.
   

  

**Drive Sales Strategy -** 
 Set sales targets and ensure pipeline and forecast accuracy. Demonstrate operational cadence and engage meaningfully with C-level executives to create value, drive commercial outcomes, and identify significant upselling opportunities
   

  

**Implement Strategic Partnerships:** 
 Develop and execute a Sell-With and Sell-To strategy by leveraging top SIs, MSPs, and consulting firms in the DACH region
   

  

**Hire, train, and coach** 
 new and existingSales Executive team members to master the MEDDPICC Sales methodology, develop compelling territory plans, integrating the best of Pega’s internal ecosystem (marketing, inside sales, legal, presales, etc.) for successful deal realization.
   

  

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Build effective working relationships with cross-functional GTM teams, including Solution Consulting, Delivery Services, Marketing, our Partner community, and the Pega Sales executive team.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. You are a natural coach and mentor, thriving in these roles. You bring to Pega a proven track record of sales and leadership performance, characterized not just by a network of C-level connections, but by a wealth of best practices and innovative approaches. You are humble, authentic, and curious, and you excel in a fast-paced SaaS environment.
   

  

**What You've Accomplished**
* BA/BS/Masters or equivalent work experience
* 12+ years of industry-related sales experience, including 5+ years of experience in sales management (minimum)
* Business or fluent Swedish & English expected.
* Enterprise SAAS and/or complex software transformation solution sales background
* Strong listening, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Ideally thought leadership on Cloud Modernization and AI Transformation.


**Pega Offers You**
* A rapidly growing yet well-established business with the world’s most innovative organizations as referenceable clients.
* A proven track record in AI, showcasing our deep understanding and continuous innovation in this field. We are recognized as leaders by analysts in emerging markets.
* A comprehensive portfolio of benefits and rewards designed to support and excite our team members.
* A culture that truly values flexibility, family, and learning .


 Job ID: 21730

title: Kubernetes Platform Engineer
description:
Conoa hjälper företag att modernisera IT-infrastruktur med fokus på Kubernetes, Cloud Native, Container-teknologi, Hybrid Cloud, IaC, CI/CD, Automatisering och DevOps.
   

  

 Linux och Open Source finns i vårt DNA, och vi utvecklas ständigt genom att dela kunskap med varandra. Vi satsar stenhårt på kompetensutveckling genom en generös utbildningsbudget, och våra medarbetare belönas för att hålla sina kunskaper i absolut framkant.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Är du en Kubernetes-expert med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem och hjälpa kunder att bygga skalbara och pålitliga plattformar? Har du erfarenhet av både cloud- och on-prem? Om så är fallet, tror vi att du skulle passa bra i rollen som Kubernetes konsult på Conoa!
   

  

 Som Kuberneteskonsult på Conoa kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras affärsbehov och designa anpassade lösningar baserade på Kubernetes som är skalbara, pålitliga och säkra både i cloud- och on-prem miljöer.
   

  

 Du kommer dels att vara ansvarig för att utvärdera våra kunders befintliga infrastruktur, identifiera områden som kan förbättras och implementera bästa praxis för Kubernetes-distribution, hantering och optimering. Men du kommer även att kunna komma in i tidiga faser av projekt och genomföra såväl design, arkitektur och implementation. Vi rekryterar både till vårt kontor i Stockholm och i Göteborg.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Arbeta nära kunder för att förstå deras affärsbehov och designa anpassade lösningar baserade på Kubernetes.
* Utvärdera kundernas befintliga infrastruktur, identifiera områden som kan förbättras och implementera bästa praxis för Kubernetes-distribution, hantering och optimering.
* Tillhandahålla teknisk vägledning och stöd under hela projektets livscykel, från design till distribution och underhåll.
* Samarbeta med våra interna team för att säkerställa att våra lösningar är anpassade till våra kunders behov och mål.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad inom de senaste trenderna och utvecklingarna inom Kubernetes och cloudinfrastruktur.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera plattformar baserade på Kubernetes.
* Stark förståelse för containeriseringsteknologier som Docker och Podman.
* Lång erfarenhet av Linux.
* Erfarenhet av automatiseringsverktyg som Ansible och Terraform.
* Kännedom om cloudplattformar som AWS, Azure eller GCP, samt on-prem infrastruktur.
* Kännedom om Kubernetes-plattformar som Rancher, OpenShift och Tanzu.
* Erfarenhet av övervaknings- och loggningsverktyg som Prometheus, Grafana och ELK-stacken.
* God problemlösningsförmåga och noggrannhet.
* Stark kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga.
* Erfarenhet av arbete som konsult eller i en kundnära roll är ett plus.
* Du talar och skriver svenska och engelska.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Om du är redo för en spännande utmaning inom och vill arbeta i ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag inom Kubernetes så har vi mycket att erbjuda. Här får du arbeta i teknikens framkant med utmaningar och projekt i moderna IT-miljöer där skalbarhet, säkerhet och automatisering är prioriterat. Du är en del av ett fantastiskt team med en varm och familjär kultur.
   

  

 På Conoa finns ett erfaret team med säljare och konsultchefer, som genom moderna arbetssätt och rätt nätverk hittar det perfekta uppdraget för dig.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i uppdrag där du utmanas och får använda din kompetens på bästa sätt. För den som vill kan detta kombineras med kortare specialistuppdrag, utbildning och workshops.
   

  

**Om Conoa**
 Conoa grundades 2012 med en stark övertygelse om att Linux och Open Source-baserade lösningar är grundbultar i modern infrastruktur. Vårt mål var att bygga ett starkt teknikfokuserat företag med en företagskultur som främjar kompetensutveckling för att ständigt vara relevanta och hjälpa företag in i nya IT-miljöer.
   

  

 2015 inleddes vår satsning inom Container-teknologi då vi blev första partner i Europa till Docker. Resan fortsatte med viktiga roller i stora kundprojekt, och att vi som första bolag i Sverige utsågs till både Kubernetes Certified Service Provider (KCSP) och Kubernetes Training Partner (KTP). Under dessa år har vi växt fram som en av Sveriges främsta specialister inom Kubernetes, Cloud Native och Container-teknologi.
   

  

 Vi har förmånen att ha ett 30-tal av Sveriges främsta specialister som medarbetare och vi hjälper några av Sveriges ledande företag att implementera modern Cloud Native infrastruktur.
   

  

 Sedan april 2021 är vi en del av Proact. Genom samgåendet får vi ännu större möjlighet att utvecklas som specialister, samt att bredda våra tjänster och geografiska närvaro.
   

  

**Vi är på en spännande tillväxtresa!**
**Vill du vara med?**
**Hör av dig!**

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
At Cision, we believe in empowering every individual to make an impact. Here, your voice is heard, your ideas are valued, and your unique perspective fuels our collective success. As part of our global team, you'll thrive in an environment that champions curiosity, collaboration, and innovation, all while making meaningful contributions to the brands we accelerate.
   

  

 Join us in shaping the future of communication and building authentic connections that matter. Whether you're solving complex problems or driving bold innovations, your growth is our success, and together, we’ll create the conversations of tomorrow.
   

  

**Empower your impact at Cision. Be seen, be understood, be you.**
 As a Customer Support Specialist, reporting into Support Management, you are working within the boundaries of 1st Tier Support, while in close collaboration with Technical Product Specialists, Customer Experience and our fantastic R&D team.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Reply to customer inquiries via supported communication channels
* Identify, replicate, and report validated product issues to the R&D team
* Identify and log feature requests
* Follow-up on customer inquiries upon issue resolution/feedback from R&D
* Provide outstanding service to our customers via prompt and value-adding interactions over phone, email and chat
* Take ownership of support tickets and be responsible for funneling them through all process stages until a resolution has been reached
* Maintain an overview of submitted cases to R&D, and flag internal SLA breaches
* Escalate support cases based on severity levels and associated business risk assessments
* Be an expert on the Brandwatch product suite and its features as they are launched and engage in feature tests
* Update internal knowledge base with new relevant insights to enhance knowledge sharing across all support team members
* Participate and contribute to roundtables, calibration and training sessions within support and cross-functional departments


**What You Have**
* Excellent English language skills, written and verbal.
* Highly customer focused; shows a real passion for the customer experience and customer support industry.
* Driven, self-starter, enthusiastic and with an “ownership” mentality.
* Adaptable and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
* Able to prioritize workload in line with customer demand.
* Proven experience in a customer-interacting role.
* Ability to collaborate with internal and external partners whilst coordinating key customer deliverables, ensuring world class customer experience.
* Advanced listening and verbal communication skills to understand customer's needs, and ability to respond clearly and concisely both verbally and written.
* Enthusiast; strong work ethic with a positive mindset, and can-do attitude.
* Influencing and negotiation skills.
* Team player that appreciates working together for a common goal.
* Working knowledge of MS Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint is required.


 As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire, a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.
   

  

 Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com.
   

  

 Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.
   

  

 Cision is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Cision will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact hr.support@cision.com
   

  

 Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Är du en strukturerad och kommunikativ ledare som vill vara med och forma framtidens IT-leveranser? Vi söker nu en Service Delivery Manager som vill ta en nyckelroll i vår satsning på att leverera IT-tjänster till fler statliga myndigheter. Bli en del av ett kunnigt och engagerat team. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 I din roll som Service Delivery Manager (SDM) kommer du att vara hjärtat i vår operativa verksamhet. Du ansvarar för att säkerställa att våra tjänster levereras med högsta kvalitet, från start till mål. Genom att löpande kommunicera status och nuläge till både interna och externa kunder, samt leda operativa möten och skapa en smidig och transparent arbetsprocess. Ditt arbete är avgörande för att bygga starka relationer och säkerställa att alla parter är nöjda.
   

  

 Skatteverket går nu in i en ny fas av uppbyggnad och innovation då vi kommer att leverera IT-tjänster och IT- drift till fler statliga myndigheter. Därför skalar vi upp och stärker våra team med nya medarbetare som vill jobba med leverans av dessa tjänster till Sveriges myndigheter.
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som har en naturlig förmåga att lyssna och förstå organisationens prioriteringar. Du ser till att processer och rutiner följs, samtidigt som du ständigt letar efter sätt att förbättra våra tjänsteleveranser. Din strukturerade arbetsmetod och uppmärksamhet på detaljer samt pragmatiska arbetssätt gör att både kunder och utvecklare känner förtroende och skapar en framdrift i våra leveranser.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens- och teknikutveckling. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor IT-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

 Du tillhör it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* känna ansvar för att leverera bästa möjliga resultat, även i situationer då kravbilden är otydlig eller outtalad
* ha god förmåga att samarbeta och samverka effektivt med olika funktioner och intressenter, samt att hålla fokus på de förväntade leveranserna
* ha ett strukturerat och metodiskt arbetssätt
* ha förmågan att hitta information och analysera detta för att använda sig i en samverkan
* ha ett gott bemötande och visa hjälpsamhet och förståelse för andra
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha förmågan att driva sin egen utveckling och ha självledarskap
* ha mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska i tal och skrift


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet som Service Delivery Manager eller liknande roll som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med kundrelationer
* god kunskap och förståelse inom IT-drift och IT-utveckling
* eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT alternativt flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant för rollen.


 Det är önskvärt att:
   

  

* ha god kännedom om leverans av tjänstedrift till externa kunder
* ha erfarenhet av att arbeta datadrivet och följa upp SLA och uppsatta mål
* ha förståelse av att arbeta med ITIL och ITSM-processer samt agil utveckling
* arbetslivserfarenhet från komplexa IT-organisationer, som tex. myndighet eller annan stor organisation


**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/369 | Kontakt: Marie Berg, rekryterande chef marie.berg@skatteverket.se, Kristoffer Sjöstrand, rekryterande chef kristoffer.sjostrand@skatteverket.se, Maria-Claudia Sun Han Cordova, hr-specialist maria-claudia.sun.han.cordova@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-04-30 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-26

title: Founding Data Scientist / Engineer
company_industry: Animal Feed Manufacturing and Software Development
description:
**About the Company** 




 Zoometry is an AgTech startup on a mission to accelerate innovation in animal feed through data. We are developing the first end-to-end SaaS platform that centralizes, simplifies, and analyzes data from animal nutrition and health trials. Our north star is to empower our customers to develop more effective and sustainable health solutions, faster.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As our
 **Founding Data Scientist / Engineer** 
 (and our very first hire! 🙂), you will work directly with the founder on a wide range of topics to build Zoometry's foundations and execute our strategy. You will be at the heart of creating our platform and our data culture.
 



  





 This will include
 


* **Building and managing Zoometry's data infrastructure** 
 (pipelines, databases, cloud)
* **Developing and implementing analyses and models** 
 (statistical, ML) to extract valuable insights from trial data
* **Organizing how we work with data** 
 (processes, technology choices, best practices)
* **Contributing to the product vision** 
 by bringing a data perspective
* **Transforming raw data into actionable value** 
 for our users via the platform
* **Collaborating closely with the founder** 
 on data and product strategy
* And much more... (it's the startup adventure!)



  





**Qualifications** 




 First and foremost, you believe that technology and data can transform traditional industries like animal nutrition, and you are passionate about contributing to more effective and sustainable animal feed. This pivotal role within an early-stage startup is perfect for a Data Engineer with an entrepreneurial spirit who wants to make a major impact. You will enjoy this role if you are a fast thinker, thrive in ambiguity and rapid change, and enjoy pushing the boundaries of your comfort zone.
 



  





**You will also need to** 



* Have solid technical expertise in Data Engineering and interest in Data Science (Python/R, SQL, Cloud platforms, ETL, Stats/ML)
* Possess a solution-oriented, autonomous, and proactive mindset
* Have a strong interest in the animal nutrition/health or AgTech domain – this would be a fantastic plus
* Embrace a positive, growth-oriented mindset ("infinite mindset")



  





**Logistics & Diversity** 




 The role can be based in Stockholm or remote (with a preference for France). We strongly believe that diverse teams perform better, so we would be thrilled if you bring a unique perspective that broadens ours
 



  





**How to apply** 




 Please send your CV and a cover letter explaining your interest in Zoometry and why you believe you are the ideal candidate for this founding role to zoometry.tech@gmail.com Highlight your relevant experience in Data Engineering and Data Science, your entrepreneurial spirit, and ideally, your interest in our industry.

title: Konsultchef inom D365 SCM till Enterprise Applications
description:
***Vi på Nexer Enterprise Applications söker en affärsinriktad och strategisk konsultchef till vårt Supply Chain Management (SCM) team. Vi är ett välkänt namn inom Microsoft Dynamics och Microsoft 365. Vill du arbeta på ett tillväxtbolag i framkant som lägger stor vikt vid individens utveckling och där du kan vara med och påverka vår resa framåt? Just nu söker vi en konsultchef med gedigen erfarenhet av SCM till ett av våra Dynamics-team!***
**Hur ser rollen ut?**
 Hos oss leder och utvecklar du ett team av SCM-experter och bidrar aktivt till vår affärsutveckling och kundrelationer. Vi söker dig som har en stark förmåga att bygga långsiktiga relationer och som drivs av att skapa värde för både kunder och medarbetare. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i vår verksamhet, ingå i ledningsgruppen för Dynamics och forma framtiden för Nexer Enterprise Applications.
   

  

 Du kommer också att ha ansvar för rekrytering av nya talanger, genomföra löne- och utvecklingssamtal samt säkerställa att våra medarbetare har rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas, både genom utveckling och coaching.
   

  

**Ort:** 
 Hybrid tjänst med bas i Stockholm
   

  

**Start** 
**:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse där vi givetvis tar hänsyn till nuvarande uppsägningstid.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du är en motiverande ledare med affärsorienterat tänkande och som vill driva förändring. Du är van vid att arbeta med olika intressenter och har erfarenhet från konsultbranschen. Det är viktigt att du har en djup förståelse för affärsprocesserna inom SCM.
   

  

 Vidare tror vi att du tidigare har arbetat med:
   

  

* Dynamics 365 SCM och/eller i en konsultroll inom SCM, alternativt som lösningsarkitekt
* Budget- och resultatansvar samt uppföljning
* Försäljning / Pre-Sales
* Personalansvar


 Du har god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Hur är det att arbeta på Nexer Enterprise Applications?**
 På Nexer Enterprise Applications har vi en familjär kultur med en bra sammanhållning i teamen. Arbetsmiljön genomsyras av en kamratlig stämning och ett nära ledarskap. Vi är ett välbekant namn när det gäller Microsoft Dynamics och Microsoft 365 inom Sverige och över hela världen. Du får möjlighet att arbeta inom Sverige och även globalt eftersom det är där våra kunder finns. Vi erbjuder en unik kombination av den stora organisationens stabilitet och den lilla verksamhetens möjlighet att påverka och få saker att hända.
   

  

 Vi har en stark vilja att driva affärer och firar våra framgångar genom regelbundna events, resor och konferenser.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om oss: https://nexergroup.com/about-us/our-business-areas/ba-enterprise-applications/
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan nedan. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via formuläret och hanterar dem löpande. Har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer, kontakta gärna Maja Åström på Maja.astrom@nexergroup.com. Vänta inte med att söka!

title: Senior IT Engineer - Identity & Access Management
description:
**About Us** 




  





  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





  





 As a Senior IT System Engineer - Identity Specialist, you will be responsible for the strategic ownership, design, and development of our corporate identity solutions using Microsoft Entra. This role requires a profound expertise in identity and access management (IAM) principles, and mandates a leadership role in shaping and securing our identity solutions in alignment with our company's Zero-Trust security framework.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  





  




* Own a domain as the subject matter expert, staying up to date on new trends and capabilities within the supporting tools and incorporating relevant changes into our Corporate IT roadmap
* Collaborate with other Corporate IT senior engineers, solution architects, domain experts and Helpdesk staff to test, deploy, communicate and support end user impacting changes into our Corporate IT
* Coordinate medium to large scale corporate IT projects, defining business requirements, designing technical solutions and coordinating a squad of L2 Engineers for its implementation, testing, global deployment and maintenance
* Work in autonomy to translate business requirements into technical solutions, leveraging our existing ecosystem and licenses everywhere possible
* Automate tasks or empower end users with self-service capabilities, in respect of our security policies, to reduce maintenance and support overhead across the team
* Oversee the definition and maintenance of our documentation corpus, both technical and end-user oriented, to facilitate maintenance and troubleshooting tasks.
* Designing, implementing and maintaining Corporate IT services in the following areas :
* 
* Identity & Access Management: Manage company identities within Microsoft Entra, encompassing employee identities and service accounts to ensure secure and efficient access control.
* Conditional Access Policies: Develop and maintain Conditional Access Policies in accordance with Zero-Trust principles, such as enforcing phishing-resistant authentication mechanism, compliant device, blocking legacy protocols, etc.
* Permissions Management: Discover and remediate and monitor permission risks for our corporate identity and resources, including in third party cloud environment
* Privileged Access Management: Implement and maintain PAM and Secrets management solutions, such as providing just-in-time access to critical resources, secure remote access using secure gateways, automated secret rotation, monitoring of privileged sessions, etc.
* IAM Solutions: Implement and manage the Identity and Access Management solutions within Microsoft Entra. Responsibilities include identity governance (joiner, mover, leaver processes), role mining, access recertification campaigns, and creating Access packages.
* B2B Security: Define and maintain secure B2B trust relationships with partners, ensuring robust security protocols are in place and adhered to.
* Workload Identities: Develop and secure Workload identities, tailoring security measures to meet specific operational needs.
* Modern Authentication Technologies: Maintain modern authentication technologies, such as Windows Hello for Business, Certificate-Based Authentication, and Passwordless phone sign-in.
* SSO and automated provisioning for Corporate Apps: Integrate and maintain corporate applications in Entra Single Sign-On (SSO) systems, setting-up SCIM, ensuring seamless access across platforms according to policies
